campaign.story:
So, what is Digitopia about?
PLAY


Digitopia is a pre-apocalyptic action adventure story of a father and daughter trying to survive in a civilisation that is imploding, where everyone from the army, society and bounty hunters are out to get them. 

Third Stretch Goal - Unlocked
Since we passed the £2k funding mark, this excellent set of digital comics is also now unlocked for all backers.

Comics courtesy of my friends at Comix Tribe.

Second Stretch Goal - Unlocked
I'm very happy to announce that we passed our second stretch goal - I'll be adding this set of retro Natiahs Wallpapers to every backer's reward - all free of charge.  

First Stretch Goal - Smashed
I'm very happy to announce that we surpassed our first stretch goal - by hitting 75 backers this fantastic digital comic back will be now be added to all backer's rewards - courtesy of my friends at Comix Tribe.  



Why is this comic book so important?
Digitopia is a book of our times - the adventure takes on 
the rise of the hard right
fake wars and the brutality of the state
fake news and what drives media biases
all encapsulated in a super high adrenaline action adventure - think 'The Matrix' meets 'The Running Man'.
In many ways Digitopia explores a lot of the issues that we are facing today.
 Can art really make a change? 
Art has always been and always will be a powerful agent of change - you backing this book won't solve everything but by backing Digitopia 1-3 you are sending out a signal that
you want fresh new content
you want content that doesn't shy away from problems we face
 you want content that challenges, not reinforces, the status quo 
If the rise of right wing extremism, state brutality and media double standards is something that concerns you then back this book and be part of the change - every bit helps.

I'm new to the series, can I catch up?
Yes absolutely, we put reward tiers in here so you can easily catch up with issues 1 and 2.
If you've already backed the previous campaigns then we have reward tiers just for issue 3.

Can I see the artwork?
Absolutely, here I've put some pages from issue 1 and issue 2, I've taken care to put artwork here that doesn't have any spoilers.  


How much of the book is done and what's left to do?
Digitopia 1 and 2 are completely finished.
On Digitopia 3 we have signed off all the layout work, we are currently more than three-quarter the way through the inks and we have started on colours.  
Here are some of the work in progress pages 
The next stage is to get funding to complete the book, we will then need to get any backer images reference photos and have them drawn in the book.  Lettering and formatting will follow.   
I love it, what great rewards can I get?
We have loads of great rewards designed for every budget, available in both Digital and paperback form.

 Digitopia 3 Digital Standard Edition - get the story as a pdf to read on your tablet, phone or computer.

 Digitopia 3 Digital Deluxe Edition - get deeper into the story, issue 3 plus lots of making of articles, concept art, layouts to final colours and lots of extra bonus content.

 Digitopia 3 Paperback + Digital Deluxe Edition - get both the Paperback and the Digital Deluxe version together of Digitopia 3.0.  I will also add in an exclusive signed art postcard for Kickstarter backers only.

 Digital Deluxe Catch Up Editions - if you're new to the series and love digital formats, then this is the option for you.  These rewards come with all the exclusive making off and behind the scenes of the book - that's over 100 pages of content for you!
 Paperback Catch Up Editions - if you're new to the series and prefer paperbacks, you'll get all three issues of Digitopia sent to you as a paperbacks, essentially a whole graphic novel sent to you in three parts, with some exclusively written content and behind the scenes artwork - includes a signed art postcard for you too.
We will be using a strong and sturdy cardboard mailers to send you your paperback books via the mail.  
 Ultimate Digital Pack - this is an amazing package for those who love digital, as well as 3 Digital Deluxe copies of the book, you'll also get an exclusive Digitopia Wallpaper pack optimised for your phone, tablet and/or desktop, all the scripts to the three issues plus a special set of audio and video commentaries recorded by the team behind all three books - that's over 100 pages of content and approx. 5 hours of entertainment in this pack.  
 Signed Paperback Pack and Ultimate Digital Pack - Get the best of both worlds, as well as everything in the Ultimate Digital Pack, get all three issues of the book signed by the author and a pack of three postcard art prints sent to you.  
Star Reward - Your opportunity to be in the book
 You In the Book - this is the final book of the Digitopia story arc, essentially that means it the last chance to be drawn into the book as either a Seventh Lion Group Rebel or as a Confederate General.  
You'll also get a special designed wallpaper with your character optimised for your mobile phone.
Special note for this reward tier:
There are only seven of these rewards, once they're gone, they're gone for good.  You'll need to send photo reference of yourself very quickly after we're funded so that the art team can get your likeness matched onto the characters.  
As soon as all the rewards are sold for this tier and we're funded, we'll run a casting session to determine which character you'll be drawn as.  

We have 4 characters in the rebel group and only 3 as Confederate Generals to go round, hence we need to do the casting quickly so we can complete the book sooner.

Who is the team behind the project?

Farhan Qureshi is the writer, who has been writing for many years, feature film, animation and now comic books.  About the script Farhan says that 'the script for Digitopia 3.0 is the best writing I've ever done, then I gave the script to Nicole, and she instantly made it twice as good'.

Nicole D'Andria is our editor for issue 3, she is a seasoned editor having edited some of the best mainstream and indie comics in recent years, including 'The Last Ember', 'House of Fear' and 'Access Denied', as well as writing her own book 'Road Trip to Hell'.   

Carlos Angeli is the projects principal artist, his impressive resume includes 'Savage Bastards', 'Space Pirates' and 'Sparrow Hawk #2'.  

Joaquin Pereyra is on colours, as well as colouring work for Sony and on the Alex Rider comic book, Joaquin's titles include Alex Ryder, Road Trip to Hell, N Force 72 and Medisin.  

As a team we have come together to create for you a book that has a captivating story merged with art that is out of this world.  
Have issues 1 and 2 been successful?
We have run three successful campaigns so far and delivered on all three of them.  To date we have had 365 backers on those campaigns.
We printed and shipped out over 150 copies of Digitopia 1.0 and the postcard art packs
In our previous Kickstarter we printed out 100 copies of Digitopia 2.0
On the back of the first campaign we were able to launch Digitopia 1.0 on Amazon - we were very pleased with its launch.
Digitopia hit number 1 in the 'Fantasy Graphic Novels' category
We hit number 2 in the 'Action & Adventure Graphic Novels' category
and we were the number 1 feature in the 'Hot New Releases' list
So all that's left now is for you to pick the reward that you like and we shall see you on the other side - thank you for all your support, whether it's digital or paperback, we look forward to getting your books to you.

The number of books that we ask the printer to order will be based on the number of backers we get in this campaign.

If these are issues that you care about and want to encourage change then please back this project today.
Thanks
Team Digitopia 3
Farhan,  Nicole, Carlos and Joaquin
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
So the world is going through a global epidemic of COVID-19. Thankfully all our team are fine, we hope you are too. You can see the art is almost complete, we have an experienced team in place who have all delivered projects against these types of constraints. 

I have checked with our printer, Comics Printing UK and they are still running at normal operations. Postal services are still running as normal.

I will keep backers up to date in case there are any changes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE: NEW KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE ISSUE 1 VARIANT JUST ADDED!
FUNDED IN 48 HOURS, 10 STRETCH GOALS, ISSUE 4 UNLOCKED! SEE BELOW FOR NEW REWARD TIERS AND ADD-ONS! THANK YOU!!!
Main Cover (A) by Rowel Roque & Lisa Moore
NEW REWARD TIERS & ADD-ONS!
JUST ADDED: Kickstarter Exclusive Issue #1 Variant!
Kickstarter Exclusive Issue 1 Variant by Rowel Roque & Lisa Moore
Get it as an Add-On or in the UPGRADED Every PC Cover Tier!
These new reward tiers now include Issue #4!
There are also TWO NEW ADD-ONS for Cover A ($5) and Cover B ($15) that can be added to ANY physical pledge!
ISSUE 4 COVERS:
Cover A by Rowel Roque & Lisa Moore!
Cover B by Federico Sabbatini (Amazing Spider-Man) and Andrea Celestini, The Last Ember art team!
 ON THE TRACK TO UNLOCKING ISSUE #4!
Issue 4 is now UNLOCKED!
ALL BACKERS will get a standard digital copy! Read above for details on Reward Tiers and Add-Ons that include Issue 4!
 MYSTERY REWARDS
ALL of the Mystery Rewards on the chart below are now UNLOCKED!
Bookmark (double-sided - both sides shown):
Train Ticket (numbered with hole-punch):
5x7 Print (art by Rowel Roque, colors by Ryan Kroboth):
Premise:
Lord and Lady Ravenscroft are two brilliant scientists and inventors whose Bohemian lifestyle and inventive ways are in direct contrast to the staid and proper ways of Victorian Era London.
Served faithfully by their steam-driven metallic Majordomo, Pneuman, and armed with a variety of elaborate self-created inventions, the Ravenscroft's pursue the one vocation that brings excitement into their world... solving murders!
PREVIOUSLY...
Brought in to consult on a mysterious murder, the Ravenscroft's began hunting down clues that might lead them to the devious culprit. Making waves and alerting the wrong people to their efforts nearly cost them their lives.
The case then took them to Austria to seek out the next piece to this chaotic puzzle of murder and mayhem they've found themselves wrapped up in.
NOW...
The crime-solving couple is headed to Romania to discover what type of vile creature is murdering the townspeople. And how is that connected to the larger mystery that sent them on their quest to begin with?
What you can expect from Pneumatic Cases!
22 pages of story in a standard size comic printed on quality paper!
Romance, drama, action and mystery!
Two covers to choose from, including a variant by K. Lynn Smith!
The penultimate issue of this suspenseful tale!
Variant Cover (B) by K. Lynn Smith (Plume, For Goodness' Sake)!
This is who will love Pneumatic Cases!
Fans of mystery and suspense stories!
 Gears, pistons and automatons!
If you like a little Supernatural tossed in with your Steampunk fare, this book is for you!
Traveling across the European landscape with the Ravenscrofts as they track down a murderer!  
Meet the Ravenscrofts!
PERCY (Lord Rupert Percival Ravenscroft)
Percy is stylish but disheveled man in his mid 30s. When he's not solving crimes with his lovely bride Annie, he can be found toiling away in his lab and naming common household appliances with unnecessarily long and complicated titles. Percy is openly loving and affectionate to his wife and is a bonafide genius. He created their majordomo Pneuman.
ANNIE (Lady Anastasia Elizabeth Ravenscroft)
Annie is a forward thinker for her time. She's brazen and outspoken, yet classy and alluring. She doesn't take too kindly to being told what a woman's place is and she'll let you know about it. She is in her late 20s and adores her intelligent husband, though she keeps him on his toes. An inventor in her own right, Annie's creations are small, elegant and powerful, with simple names to match.

 Meet the creators behind Pneumatic Cases!
John is a Comic Book Writer, Artist and Colorist. He owns and operates The Dragonwerx Studios, Monkeywerx Comics and Clockwerx Monkey Toys & Games. He recently successfully funded his first children's book, BLUE, on Kickstarter. John is also a Steampunk enthusiast and Comic Book Guy.
Rowel is a penciler/inker based in the Philippines. He's worked in Animation and Comic Book Illustration. In addition to his amazing work on Pneumatic Cases, some notable projects he's done include Binary Gray for Assailant Comics and The Ballad of Rory Hawkins for Caliber Comics.
Lisa is a Comic Book enthusiast, colorist and illustrator working in and around the industry since 2007. She has colored titles such as Garfield, Peanuts and Bravest Warriors for BOOM! Studios and worked on other well known properties like Grimm, Big Trouble In Little China, and Care Bears. She is also the writer of The Secrets of Willowmyst here at Last Ember Press.
Clay is an actor, writer and director, best known for his animation voice-over work and as a co-creator for FRIED Comics. An alum of the Comics Experience lettering course, he currently letters the book RED XMAS for FRIED. You can read his work for free at friedcomics.com/free
Brant is the Co-Publisher of Last Ember Press and creator/writer of The Last Ember series and co-writer of Celestial Falcon. He has also been lettering comics for the better part of two decades, with work published through Image Comics, Action Lab Entertainment, Arcana, Moonstone, AC Comics and more. He is also a co-host of Comic Book Weekly, a podcast ranking Top 5 comics of the week and more.

Why this book?
John Wilson, the creator and writer of Pneumatic Cases (PC),  is an avid Steampunk fan as well as a fan of Holmesian murder mysteries. PC is a book he was working on for years trying to get off the ground before LEP was formed. It became one of our two launch titles and remains one of our best sellers online and at conventions.
John Wilson with Pneumatic Cases and other works back when cons were a thing!
Why we have come back to Kickstarter
We successfully funded Issue #2 of Pneumatic Cases after self-funding the first issue. The community was so supportive of the book, and has continued to be supportive of our other titles and offerings. So it was a no-brainer to return to the platform for the third issue.
This campaign is to fund printing costs and get Pneumatic Cases #3 into the hands of eager readers as soon as possible. The pencils and inks are complete, and the coloring and lettering is underway and will be finished by the end of the campaign!
WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR
Here's the breakdown of where the funds raised during this campaign will go. The largest cost, as we said above, is for printing.


The art is all done for this book, you can get a glimpse of it all here.  Coloring and lettering will be complete by the time funds arrive for the campaign. So we can will be heading straight to the printer! 
 Here are the reward tiers you can pledge to get!
We literally couldn't do this without you!
On behalf of John, Rowel, Lisa, myself and everyone with Last Ember Press, we can't thank you enough for your all your continued support! This issue has been a long time coming and we can't wait to get it in your hands sooner than later!

Please spread the word and share your support of Pneumatic Cases #3 with all your friends!
You can share it with these links:
SHARE PNEUMATIC CASES #1-3 ON FACEBOOK
SHARE PNEUMATIC CASES #1-3 ON TWITTER
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Backer's support on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of Last Ember Press since our very first project in 2017. That success would not have been possible without all the backers and supporters like you for the past three years who have continued to come back and support our new launches.

We take your trust very seriously, believe that!

While this book is not yet finished, the interior art is complete and all that remains is finalizing colors and lettering. We are confident we can finish these quickly.

We have established a strong relationship with a quality printer that we have worked with several times in the past who does great work and helps to insure we deliver the best product possible.

Every campaign here on Kickstarter does come with a certain amount of risk, unforeseen obstacles and lessons learned. We continue to learn with every launch.

Right now, with the state of the world what it is here in 2020, we know that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment is an absolute must, and should any unforeseen issues arise causing delays, our backers will be the first to know!

Are are dedicated and committed to delivering a great experience and quality reward delivery experience for our backers, so we've invested in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles and we're handling fulfillment 100% in-house to eliminate any risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

Last Ember Press has a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we are fortunate enough to enjoy so much support from returning backers is evidence of that.

So you can back this campaign with confidence, and we hope to entertain you for years to come!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
I just noticed it had been a little over a month since my last update, so I wanted to clue everyone in on the progress of both issues.
First, I'll also let you know that we got moved into the new house, been there for about two and a half weeks, give or take. So while we're mostly settled in, we're still getting back into regular work patterns. And currently, we had to go out of town for some appointments I had to keep.

Hey everyone!
Sorry this is a day later than promised, but moving is a lot of work!
Anyway, let's kick this off with a sneak peek at...
ISSUE 4 INKS!

updates.update_userinfo: Not So Fair Tales (Plus an Update)
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Man, we can't even express how thrilled we are with how well this campaign did! I mean it's beyond all expectations we had going in. To go over $12K and nearly 400 backers is just AMAZING!
So thank you for that!

Hey all!
Here we are with less than an hour to go! 
This has been quite the ride, and before it's over, I just wanted to say one more quick THANK YOU to everyone that has supported this campaign.
You'll be hearing from me tomorrow and of course as things progress with the books as well, so stay tuned for that.

Hello, Hello, Hello!
We are now at the 36 hour mark and frankly blown away!
Last night, we went over to help move some stuff into my in-laws' new house, and when we got home the campaign had hit $10,000! 
On the dot!

Hey everyone!
You've gotten us to $9K! Woohoo! That's just... we're blown away! Thank you!
So to celebrate (and because I already teased it yesterday), we have a new product!
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE ISSUE #1 VARIANT

Hello again!
As we approach the $9K mark, with just a few days left of the campaign, I figured why not have some fun with a game!
Caption This!

Hey all,
I want to share this really cool project that just launched by my good friends Kat Calamia and Phil Falco!
HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1

Hey everyone!
I hope you're having an awesome weekend. My wife and I just got our second Moderna shots today, so we're on our way to fully vaccinated after the two week period!
I wanted to post both to celebrate because...

campaign.story:
CREATIONS VOL. 2
Creations Vol 2 is the second installment in my NEW "Creations" Artbook Series and is a compilation of hundreds of my original designs, sketches and finished artwork from the past year. Beautifully printed across 100 full color pages, it is 7.5 x 10" in size with a soft matte cover. This book is for all ages showcasing character designs, concept art, and visual development.  It's a great book for professional artists, art directors, aspiring creators or just fans of art and pop culture. Printed In CANADA

The Digital Book is also available for those that want to view it on their devices! Download the PDF and view Creations Vol 2 in Hi-Res on your Phone, Tablet or PC! 
 ALL STRETCH GOALS ARE UNLOCKED!!! 
FOR ANY BACKERS OF THE PHYSICAL BOOK YOU GET ALL THESE BONUS ITEMS FREE!
Kickstarter has introduced ADD-ON Items! You can now add these extras to any of your reward tiers! This makes it easier to customize what you want:)
CREATIONS VOL. 1 (Includes Digital PDF) 
Creations Vol 1 is my first art book that is entirely composed of original designs. The book is jam packed with hundreds of illustrations, beautifully displayed across 100 pages and is 7.5 x 10" in size with a soft cover. Successfully funded on Kickstarter in 2020 and Printed In CANADA
BOT-9 Graphic Novel
Bot-9 is a 64 Page wordless Graphic Novel by Derek Laufman. This is a story about a fish that finds itself on an eye opening journey in the head of a robot. Go on an adventure with Bot-9 and explore a world that is full of wonder, mystery and danger in this all ages tale. The size of the book is 6x9" printed in full color with a soft gloss cover. Printed In CANADA
RUINWORLD Graphic Novel
RuinWorld: Eye For An Eye Is A Compilation Of The  5 Issues Mini Series Published By BOOM! Studios In 2018. Adventurers Rex And Pogo Trek Across The Ruinlands Searching For Treasure And Magical Artifacts, Along With Their Not-Always Faithful Companions. 144 Action Packed Pages!
 HARD ENAMEL PINS
For the first time ever I'm creating limited edition Hard Enamel Collector Pins! You can collect a BOT-9 Pin or the Pogo and Rex Pin Set. These items are available in multiple tiers or as ADD-ON Items. 
Size: 1.75" tall
Medium: Hard Black Nickel enamel pins. Includes a rubber clutch and backing card.
Enamel Pins Mockup
All commissions are for a single character. NOTE: Existing pop culture characters ONLY. NO NUDITY OR SEXUALIZED images. 
BUST/FULL BODY Commissions are drawn in ink and either finished with ink wash or screen tones, at artist's discretion.
CHIBI Commissions are created digitally. A signed print can be included upon request. 
I have been a professional artist for over 20 years and I reside In London, Ontario CANADA. I studied Classical animation at Sheridan College which led to a 10 year career in game development. For the past several years now, I have been a full time freelance illustrator/designer working out of my home for Marvel, Warner Bros., Disney Publishing, Hasbro and Mattel. I had the pleasure of designing Marvel’s Super Hero Adventure line as well as DC’s Super Friends new toddler focused branding. In 2018 I released my first creator owned mini series RuinWorld, published by BOOM! Studios and in 2020 I released a new graphic novel titled BOT-9.
 BEORN: THE LITTLEEST VIKING SAGA by Ben Bender
"Ben Bender is the creator of BEORN: The Littlest Viking Saga, and with your help he's printing BOOK TWO of this all-ages adventure comedy!"
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/thelittlestviking/beorn-book-two
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Covid still poses a potential road block in producing and shipping goods around the world, but it's improving and we are confident that are production partners will deliver on time. We've allotted ample production time in case we run into issues. My wife and I have been successfully shipping from my online store on a weekly basis all through the pandemic. After the success of shipping 3 previous Kickstarter campaigns, my wife and I now have experienced the full scope of shipping over 2500 physical backer rewards. Our previous experience shipping items saved us a lot of heart ache and allowed us to ship almost all rewards on or ahead of schedule. We have a good working relationship with our printer located in Montreal Canada and after speaking with them and setting print dates, I don't foresee any problems hitting our delivery schedule. There are always unforeseen problems that can arise especially during the pandemic but we do our best to help mitigate those issues and make sure the experience of backing our projects is a happy one.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
COUNTING, COLORS & CTHULHU is a beautifully illustrated, premium board book from the creators of C is for Cthulhu & Sweet Dreams Cthulhu that teaches numbers and colors using adorable Lovecraft inspired monsters.
To help celebrate this explosively colorful new Lovecraftian children's book, we're also bringing back our most colorful C is for Cthulhu plush ever created, the SOLD OUT RAINBOW C IS FOR CTHULHU PLUSH (12 in.) and making it available for the first time ever in our wildly popular BABY PLUSH SIZE (6 in.), creating the perfect plush toy compliment to the new book! 
NEW! And to celebrate this campaign cracking the TOP TEN MOST FUNDED CHILDREN'S BOOK PROJECTS in Kickstarter history, we're also releasing an all-new shiny metallic GOLD C is for Cthulhu Plush! Who needs an Oscar when you can put this limited edition beauty on your shelf?!!
About the Counting, Colors & Cthulhu Board Book:
Young Howard Lovecraft has a problem: Strangely colored creatures are appearing all over Providence, and they seem to be multiplying! 
Help Howard and his good friend Cthulhu navigate through a horde of cuddly cute monsters and develop number & color recognition and counting skills in a fun and visually engaging way! 
This new book features stunning, fully painted illustrations of our beloved creepy, yet cuddly renditions of some of H.P. Lovecraft's most iconic creations. You'll delight to find, "TWO GREEN DEEP ONES,SWIMMING IN THE SEA..."
And of course you'll discover "EIGHT RED NECRONOMICONS,SWIRLING IN THE DARK..."
...and you may even stumble upon "TEN SLEEPY CTHULHUS! What colors do YOU see?" 
Counting, Colors & Cthulhu is the newest book from the acclaimed creators of C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book, and Sweet Dreams Cthulhu, a Lovecraftian Bedtime Story. 

This beautifully illustrated, premium hardcover book is sure to make learning fun for young and old ones alike!
Book Details
24-page hardcover board book featuring digitally painted illustrations of Cthulhu, H.P., Hastur, Shoggoth, Deep Ones, the Black Goat and more creepy and colorful Lovecraftian monsters as you've never seen them before!
This children's book is written with a delightful rhyming scheme that will help your little monsters learn their colors and numbers... and the mythos!
Loaded with colorful Cthulhus, your little ones will revel in spotting a little Cthulhu hiding on every page! 
A durable, laminated, high-quality board book that will stand up to countless bedtime readings to your insatiable little monsters.
The perfect companion to C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book and Sweet Dreams Cthulhu, making it a must have addition to the Lovecraftian libraries of fans of all ages.
"Uncle" Jason writes:
There’s a great history of monsters teaching kids to count. 
For me, it was THE COUNT from Sesame Street (Ah ah ah), and the loveable Cookie Monster. 
For my kids, it was those plus the nightmarish demons featured on Yo Gabba Gabba! (shudder) 
Kids are naturally attracted to these weird, colorful, and outrageous creatures because they fire their imaginations. 
Few of us remember the mundane early learning books we grew up on – not because they weren’t effective, but because, well, they were filled with the same dull things we saw around us everyday. 
This is one of the reasons we created C is for Cthulhu, and why we're now doing a counting and colors book. 
Kids are dreamers, with imaginations that spiral endlessly in a million directions at once. 
They’re hungry for the extraordinary and bizarre, and their appetites are insatiable. Feed them! 
Encourage the dreaming and creativity and story making and unconventional thinking.
Your little monsters will thank you for it one day.

The 9th Campaign from the C is for Cthulhu Team: 50,000+ Happy Cultists Have Shared the Lovecraft With Us! 
Over the past eight years, the C is for Cthulhu team has run nine successful Kickstarter campaigns supported by more than 6,500+ incredible backers to bring the C is for Cthulhu Books, Plush Toy, and more to life.
To date, the original C is for Cthulhu book has been downloaded more than 50,000 times and has now been translated into four languages with more foreign translations still to come. And the sequel, Sweet Dreams Cthulhu cracked the top-ten all-time funded Children's Books in Kickstarter history back in 2017!
None of this would have been possible without the support of fans like you!
And so we’ve once again returned to Kickstarter to launch our latest and greatest book book yet… COUNTING, COLORS & CTHULHU.
Kickstarter first put the C is for Cthulhu team on the map in 2014, and has provided an opportunity for us to reach, energize and connect with the thousands of fans we’ve made over the years.
Over the past eight campaigns, we’ve built one of the best Facebook Communities with more than 35K fans, who have helped us significantly overfund every single campaign, enabling us to give books and products to worthy causes and make high quality products Lovecraft fans of all ages can’t get enough of!
HOW WILL THE KICKSTARTER FUNDS BE SPENT?
The funds raised from this Kickstarter will go toward a large off-set first printing of COUNTING, COLORS & CTHULHU as well as help fund a NEW production run to bring back the RAINBOW C is for Cthulhu Plush in both Standard (12 in) and NEW Baby (6 in.) sizes.
The success of this Kickstarter launch will us help make sure that Lovecraft fans worldwide can get their hands on COUNTING, COLORS & CTHULHU for years to come.
WHAT IF YOU EXCEED YOUR FUNDING GOAL?
Any funds raised above our goal will go toward:
Enhancing the book and the campaign to make it even more valuable for our incredible backers.
Helping us restock our inventory of C is for Cthulhu Plush Toys and other fan favorite merchandise.
Bringing back SOLD OUT limited edition products and plush toys... and we'll be getting backer feedback to help us decided which products are brought back! 
New product development, so we can make even more awesome Lovecraftian stuff.

To help be a part of this amazing campaign, we invite you to select one of the following incredible reward tiers packed with C is for Cthulhu goodies!
Want to customize your pledge even further? Maybe add another book or get one of our awesome plush toys in addition to your pledge rewards? You can! Here are the awesome EXTRAS that you'll be able to ADD-ON to your pledge level:

Counting, Colors & Cthulhu is the third Lovecraftian children's board book from the 
C is for Cthulhu Team!
Our talented team has a long track-record of producing incredible content for some of the most respected entertainment brands in the world. Here's who are making this new book for you:
This new book is written by "Uncle" Jason Ciaramella, who is an author, screenwriter, and brand developer who has worked on many of the most recognizable pop culture properties on the planet, including Godzilla, Transformers, Magic: The Gathering, Ninja Turtles, and G.I. Joe. He lives on a hill, in a very old house in Plymouth, Massachusetts, with his wife, their four teenage sons, and a wonderful dog.
Joining the team for Counting, Colors & Cthulhu is illustrator extraordinaire Joshua Janes, a graduate of the Joe Kubert School of Cartooning & Graphic Arts, with more than twenty years experience in the world of children's publishing, working for companies including Google, Disney, Warner Bros, McGraw-Hill and many others.
Editing, Publishing and Producing this book and project is Tyler James. Tyler is the publisher of ComixTribe and the host of the ComixLaunch Podcast, which has taught thousands of creators how to harness the power of Kickstarter to bring their dream projects to life. 
Tyler's young son Cullen has also helped model new C is for Cthulhu merchandise over the past three years!

More About C is for Cthulhu Plush Toys
Brought to life from the pages of C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book, this adorable plush produced in partnership with Skelton Crew Studio is a super-soft elder god that will keep your little ones cozy all through the night.
Product Details:
Super-soft premium fabric manufactured using the highest quality materials.
Custom embroidered eyes and other details, with crinkle-material added to the wings for extra texture and fun!
Currently Available in Two Awesome Sizes! Standard with a standing height of 12 inches (30.5 cm) or BABY with a standing height of 6 inches (15.25 cm).
A beanie bottom bum for posed shelf sitting.
Child safety tested in the USA.
Soft, huggable, and completely lovable.
The perfect gift for Lovecraft fans of all ages.
Currently Available in THREE AMAZING COLORS: GREEN, GLOW-IN-THE-DARK, and RAINBOW*
*MORE C IS FOR CTHULHU PLUSH COLORS MAY BECOME UNLOCKED SHOULD THIS CAMPAIGN CRUSH IT'S FUNDING GOALS! We invite our backers to help us decide which colors to bring back first!

More About C is for Cthulhu Books
C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book
C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book is a lushly illustrated, premium alphabet board book, featuring monsters and characters inspired by the mythos of H.P. Lovecraft.
This high-quality board book that started it all, features gorgeous Lovecraft-themed illustrations for every letter of the alphabet.
Our best-selling book features:
26 Lovecraft-themed illustrations, featuring Cthulhu, H.P., Hastur, Black Goat, Eldritch, and many more!
The perfect blend of creepy and cuddly, making this a favorite book of Lovecraft fans of all ages.
Durable, laminated board book with a spot-UV treated cover.
Sweet Dreams Cthulhu: A Lovecraftian Bedtime Book
Sweet Dreams Cthulhu: A Lovecraftian Bedtime Book was the long-awaited follow up to the smash hit C is for Cthulhu, and it delivered!
In his house at R'Lyeh, Cthulhu can't sleep! It's up to his friend Howard Lovecraft to help him overcome his nighttime fears and reveal the truth about things that go bump in the night! This lavishly illustrated bedtime story is sure to charm young and old ones alike! Sweet Dreams Cthulhu is a timeless tale perfect for helping children deal with their fears with when the lights go out.
C is for Cthulhu Coloring Book
Share the Lovecraft with your little monsters by coloring Cthulhu, Hastur, H.P. and more in this creepy and cuddly coloring book.
The C is for Cthulhu fan community asked for it, so we've created a high quality, 48-page coloring book, full of all-ages friendly creatures inspired by the work of H.P. Lovecraft.
Full color sticker sheet included in every coloring book!
Have fun with your little monsters coloring the entire Lovecraft Alphabet from A to Z! 
Includes bonus Lovecraft-themed activity pages for young and Old Ones!
Bonus page of full-color C is for CthulhuStickers! 
 Digital Deluxe Back-up! Every book comes with a print-ready PDF of the entire book, so if there are pages you'd like to color again and again, you can print more yourself at home!
The perfect companion to C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Board Book and the C is for Cthulhu Plush Toy! 
Will You Help Us Share the Lovecraft for Cthulhu Fans Everywhere By Helping Fund This New Board Book?
If you made it this far, you’re probably a fan of H.P. Lovecraft, Cthulhu, and premium quality collector's items that will be appreciated by young and old ones alike.
You also love discovering weird, high quality board books and reading them with your little monsters.
We continue to be honored and humbled by the support our Kickstarter backers have shown us over the past seven years, which has enabled us to share the Lovecraft worldwide.
If you’ve supported us in the past, welcome back again, friend!
And if you’re new to the C is for Cthulhu family, and this is your first Kickstarter with us, you’re in good company as over 6,500 backers have supported our projects in the past!
We’d like to ask for your support by backing this Kickstarter and adding COUNTING, COLORS & CTHULHU  to your Lovecraftian library, so we can get this book into thousands more homes around the world!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 
Thanks in advanced for supporting this Kickstarter and sharing the Lovecraft with us once more.
With gratitude,
- The entire C is for Cthulhu Team
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the 9th Kickstarter campaign by the C is for Cthulhu team and the 21th campaign run by ComixTribe publisher Tyler James. While every campaign has its own unique challenges, we've taken several steps to mitigate the risks for this project.

With the support of our backers, C is for Cthulhu has built a reputation for quality products, and we hold ourselves to a high standard for delivering. The Counting, Colors & Cthulhu book is complete and ready to print as soon as this campaign is completed. We've also already invested in and have in hand prototypes for the new products being offered during this campaign.

The only thing left to do is raise the funding to complete payment on a large production run during this campaign, place our final order, produce the books and plush toys, collect your shipping information, and start shipping everything once the new products arrive.

We're well aware of the many challenges associated with delivering on a Kickstarter campaign, and know that problems arise in every campaign.

In the past, we've made every effort to deliver on our promises to backers and maintain strong communication with them throughout the fulfillment process of every campaign.

We don't consider a project successful unless 100% of our backers have been fulfilled. We hope you'll give us the opportunity to make you a C is for Cthulhu fan for life!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Well, the thing I made is a comic book.  It is 8-pages long, but that's just the comics part.  There's also a cover and a back cover and some other words my Dad told me to write on the inside so everyone knows I'm the one who made it.  
5.5" x 8.5", 8-page, black and white, comic book +cover
In the story, there's this guy with a horn, his name is Honk, and he has some friends named Pig and G.  "G" stands for goat, but he doesn't exactly look like a goat.  And there's also a bully when they go to this school.  He's not very nice, but the story kind of shows what to do in a situation like that.

I'm a 7-year-old boy and I'm good at Math and I like to draw.  It's nice to draw.  And also I'm a tall kid in my class.  My name is Owen.  

Why I'm sending this out is because it's not a good thing to be bullied.  You should stand up to that bully if they are bullying you or someone else.  If you see a bully bullying someone else, then you are a bystander and you should report the bullying, the same as if someone was bullying you.


Honk and Freands - "Jungle Gym", full-color, limited-edition, 5.5" x 8.5", print.
Author with Original Artwork (8.5" x 11", marker and crayon)

Me and my dad are printing Honk comic books so we can send them out to people.  My dad has some experience making and giving comics to people.  He's a comic artist, he makes watches, and he even has some comics classes that he teaches.

My parents asked me how much money I would be happy with.  $20 sounds like a lot to me, so that's what my dad put as our goal.

After we make the books, then we will send them out to people who would like the Honk comic.  My dad has this weigher thing just for mail, so we can weigh it and then we will know how much it costs to mail it.  Then we can just mail it to people who want it.  

This is the way we think our plan will happen:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hm...well, some risks and challenges that I might include are that the comic we send off to you in the mail might come a little bit late, because our mail service is a little behind these days because a lot of people don't want to go to the store. So, the mail people have a lot on their shoulders. Like me, I had to wait for a remote control stunt car that took 3 more days than what they told me. So when we mail the books it might take a little while. But to help that, me and my dad are saying, "Maybe it'll take one or two weeks longer," just so we have enough time. He says this is a contingency. 

Something else I wanted to say is that the entire comic book is already drawn, so you won't have to wait for me to finish that.

Another risk could be, you know, what if our printer doesn't have any printing-out stuff. But to make sure that doesn't happen, we have an extra load of that stuff that helps the printer print stuff out. 

My dad is also helping me a lot by printing the comic and typing what I say here. My mom said she would help, too, but I don't know with what part. Maybe stapling the comics and packing them up. So, it's not just me working on this. It's kind of like a family effort.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Fine Folks,
Owen's Dad here with a final report to all backers.

Final Expense Report
We wanted to be completely transparent about what was happening with the unexpected windfall of cash that you each bestowed upon us.  The short of it goes like this:

Hi Everyone,
Guess what showed up right before the weekend.  The special prints!  So, I put numbers and my name on all 125 of them.

Hi,

 Limited-Edition Print Delay
We did not get the special prints yet.  They say they're on their way.  It feels like it's taking a long time, but I'm sure they'll get here pretty soon.  Mr. Rogers has a song that talks about how it's very, very, very hard to wait.

Hi,

Fulfillment Continues
After the mail person picked up those 20 books yesterday, we packed a whole lot more.

Hi, everyone!

Fulfillment Starts
Today was our first day of packing up books.  When I woke up this morning, I came downstairs and saw my daddy doing this...
Guess what showed up yesterday!

Hi Everyone,

The last time I talked to you was last week.  This week there haven't been a lot of exciting things happening, but we do want to tell you how things are going and answer a question we got.

Hi again,
Guess what came today!

Book Proof
Dave the print man and my first Honk book!

Hi everybody,

My dad told me about a couple of things today so I'm going to tell you about these things, too.

Printing Delay

campaign.story:
Sacrimony #1 was featured on Comics Beat!
We've hit the 75 backer mark and the bonus postcard has been unlocked! Can we get to 100 backers in the remaining few days??
Here is our postcard in all her majestic glory, just waiting to find a good home :)
Add-Ons are also now available! Read more about them here!
Khajad  Laohua has no memory of her past, no explanation as to why she has magical powers or why she must hide her peculiar white demon wings from society. Her mother, Yunika, thinks it's best to avoid  answering any of Khajad's questions. For now, they must figure out a way to escape what is certain to become their icy graves at the Peak of the World. Together, they venture to find a place called "home" and a means of living a normal life.
But can their lives ever really be "normal?"
Sacrimony: A Tale of Love, Life and Death - In No Particular Order #1  is a 30 page standard comic book in full color. It features beautiful art,  a diverse cast of fully fleshed-out characters and colorful, unique fantasy world! Other rewards include stickers, enamel pins, magnets, prints and custom commissions.
If you're into character-driven stories dealing with complex relationships such as the Avatar series and Game of Thrones, then Sacrimony is perfect for you.
(Recommended for mature readers on account of language and adult situations)


Hi there! I'm M Sorcier, the sole creator behind Sacrimony: A Tale of Love, Life and Death - In No Particular Order. I'm a self-taught artist and writer born and raised in New York and a first generation immigrant hailing from the teeny Caribbean island nation of Trinidad and Tobago. 
Unlike many other comic creators my age, I didn't spend my younger years hanging around my local comics shop and writing letters to Stan Lee with dreams of working for Marvel. I couldn't afford comics and all I really had was pencils, paper and an imagination that won't quit. I developed a passion for art and telling stories at a very early age, but I didn't know what to do with that passion or what my options even were.
Life ended up taking over and while my peers were out studying art, writing their scripts, getting books published and running super successful Kickstarter campaigns, I was out working minimum wage retail jobs and dead-end internships, with no real direction in life, while still pursuing art and storytelling as just a thing I did to keep sane.
Sacrimony was an idea that I had in my head since my early teenage years but I didn't really start doing anything with it until my early 30's. So here I am at the tender age of 36, fearing that I stepped into the game way "too late", but I'm still trying my best.
I created Sacrimony because I wanted the kind of story I never had  growing up. I could never really relate to the stories that had clear-cut, black-and-white heroes and villains because they just never felt like real life to me. Despite being a fantasy story with imaginary settings and races, Sacrimony at its core, is a story of love, family, friendship and what it means to be “human.” Everyone is multi-faceted and capable of good, bad and everything in between and they’ll do whatever they have to in order to navigate the world and cope with being dealt a bad hand in life.
Honestly? Because I have no other means of getting my books out there.  I have a story that I want to tell and Kickstarter is such a great way to be able to raise the funds to actually do it while finding a wonderful, passionate audience. Not only that, self-publishing through Kickstarter allows me to have full creative control over my own project which is something that is very important to me.
Funds will be used for the cost of printing the books and all other merch, kickstarter fees, and covering the costs of shipping. If I have  anything left over, I might buy myself some ice cream to celebrate.  Because I'm worth it!
Want to see what happens next? You can download an extended preview here! Or back the comic on Kickstarter and get the whole thing :)


Thank you so much for taking the time to check out Sacrimony #1! It  would mean a lot to me if you backed this project in order to help me get this story out into the world.
This book will be the first of many, so stay tuned!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The art for the book is complete and ready to go off to the printers as soon as I'm done making the Thank You section. All other merch illustrations are done and also ready to be sent off to their respective printers the moment funds are available (or made by yours truly in the case of magnets and prints). 

Basically, everything is ready. I have 11 years of experience running an online store with a solid 5 star rating (https://www.etsy.com/shop/metalsorceryart/), so I'm very familiar with all the snags that can be hit when it comes to manufacturing and shipping.

I've estimated the shipping date for rewards to allow a reasonable amount of time to account for things beyond my control like reprints and shipping delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello there!
We're  a month and a half away from Sacrimony #2 going live and I'm very  excited to announce the first milestone goal. I wanted to do something  to generate more hype about the campaign, and get more folks on board so I'm announcing that if I get to 75 followers before the campaign  launches, all physical backers for Sacrimony #2 will get a free sticker!
Here he is in all of his grumpy glory:

Hello hello!
It's kind of crazy to say but this campaign is (mostly) complete! As of today, I've shipped out all rewards to those who filled out backer surveys and I'm still waiting on 4 people to fill theirs out to officially officially close this chapter. 
So what's next, hmm?
Issue #2 goes live on July 22, 2021! That's what's next!
If you enjoyed issue #1 and want to see where the story goes from there, here's a If you hit "Notify me on launch," you'll get a heads up when the campaign goes live.

Hello, dear backers!
A lot has happened over the past weekend! Lookey what I got~

Hihi!
Hope you're all having a great week, my wonderful backers!
I've just finished sending out the digital rewards! You should have received an email from WeTransfer containing
Sacrimony #1 Wallpaper Pack

Hello, my dear backers!
I know I usually post updates on Tuesdays or Wednesdays, but things had been quiet and I had nothing to say. It seemed a bit pointless to say "Hey, everyone, still waiting to hear back from manufacturers. No actual update yet."
This morning, I got a very exciting email from the pin manufacturer - I now have tracking information for the pins and they're on the way to me! They've been sent via FedEx (which is always a little cursed for me and things get stuck in limbo) so I'm not yet sure when they'll arrive. Fingers crossed it'll be the end of next week, but if it's earlier you'll definitely be hearing from me with lots of pics!

Hello, my dear backers!
It's that wonderful time of the week where I let you know what's been going on with Sacrimony #1!
A lot has happened in the last seven days...
First off, WE HAVE STICKERS! AND THEY'RE ADORABLE! My usual printer was swamped, which is why she didn't get back to me right away, but she came through for me mid-last week and I didn't have to find someone new! Hooray!

Hello, dear backers!
The wheels have officially been set in motion! Here's what I've done so far over the past week:
Sticker designs have been submitted to the printer. I'm waiting on them to get back to me with an invoice. 
The bonus postcard is being printed as I type this. Not ETA yet.

Hello, my wonderful backers!
Long time no speak! Er.. type? Long time no type? You get the idea.
Anyway, I'm still waiting for Kickstarter to unleash the funds, which should be happening annnnnyyyy minute now. Most likely tomorrow. In the meanwhile, I'm working on sending out surveys tonight so that I can ensure you get your sweet, sweet rewards on time.

campaign.story:
Hi! I'm Lisa LaRose, a Canadian painter and comic artist. I love to make detailed and delightful paintings from the strange ideas that pop into my head.  I spend my days painting in acrylics or making comics, and I earn my keep by selling paintings/prints and other items online.  This will be my third Kickstarter project!
I spend an average of 100 hours working on each painting.
Some of the places you can find me/ see more of my art and art-making:
 Website             Etsy             Instagram             Twitter             Facebook             TikTok 

So why make puzzles?
I love doing puzzles, but often when I am shopping for a new puzzle, I have a hard time finding an image that appeals to me. Cottages, landscapes, and balls of yarn are well and dandy... but where is the WEIRD STUFF?
So I thought...  what if I made my art into puzzles?
This Kickstarter is for funding the first 3 of my puzzle designs!
 I have these 3 designs planned, proofed, and ready to be printed!  
Puzzles are a fun activity to do solo or with friends/ family. They make a great gift too! 
Based on my puzzle experience, these puzzles are a medium-difficulty. If you are concerned about difficulty, Toad Queen is the easiest of the three. Pick Star Fish if you are feeling up for more of a challenge.
1000 pieces!
 Completed puzzle size: 20"x 27" (50cm x 70cm)
 Box size: 9.25" x 7.75" x 2.25" (24cm x 20cm x 6cm)
 Bonus half-size poster print included (no fighting over the box top!)
Standard puzzle size.
Since I love to do puzzles myself, there were a few things that were absolutely necessary for my puzzles to have. After many many months of sampling and researching, I have a manufacturer that meets all my needs!

1) Good color reproduction
My art is all about color and I wanted that to translate to the puzzles

 2) A cute box (the ability to use my own design) 
The design looks really nice on this cute lil' box size!

3) Pieces with unique shapes
I wanted all the standard shapes and enough variation in the cut so you definitely know when it's the right piece.
They aren't as crazy as some puzzles I've seen, but they are unique enough to help when it comes to those tricky areas.

4) Pieces stick together
You can work on sections and move them into place no problem! Heck, you can even pick up the whole puzzle without it falling apart! (see the gif above)
*PLEASE NOTE* shipping will not be charged via Kickstarter and will be collected later using Backerkit. 
Please consult this table for shipping price estimates:
These estimates are based on shipping prices right now (in March) and may change slightly if postage rates go up between now and when the shipping is collected.
 Canadians: One of the advantages of Backerkit is I can charge shipping by province/region. The prices in the chart are the highest estimates. Shipping will be slightly cheaper than this for BC, AB, SK, ON, QC.

VANCOUVER LOCAL PICKUP: *New* For those in the Vancouver, BC area who want to pick up your rewards (and not pay shipping), I will have a free local pickup option at New World Designs located downtown Vancouver near Waterfront Station.

You MUST check your email: 
Please use an email that you will check, and keep an eye out for emails from Kickstarter and Backerkit. If you do not fill out your Backerkit survey when it is sent to you, I will not be able to send you your puzzles. 
You should also keep an eye on your email in case your Kickstarter payment doesn't go through. If there is an issue when Kickstarter tries to collect your payment when the campaign is over, you will have only 1 week to fix it.


Timeline: 
I currently have a deposit down for 500 Life puzzles to secure my quote pricepoint. Once the goal has been met, I will increase my deposit to include the 500 Star Fish and 500 Toad Queen puzzles.  

Once the campaign ends, it will take 2 weeks for Kickstarter to give me the funds so that I may pay for the order. I will also need to send out surveys (for those getting multiple puzzles) so can confirm I am ordering the right amount of each design.

Puzzle production is estimated to take 1 month. Due to the size and weight of the puzzles, they must be shipped to me via boat, which will take 35-38 days. 

I will be fulfilling/ shipping international (non-USA) orders first, as they will have the slowest shipping time. The current time estimation is August 2021. 


Kickstarter video music:
Easy Lemon by Kevin MacLeod
https://incompetech.filmmusic.io/song/3697-easy-lemon/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
•COVID: We aren't out of the woods yet, and outbreaks could cause delays in manufacturing/ shipment.
Some countries may not be accepting packages from Canada, so please check with your local post office.

•Increase in material costs/ crazy changes in USD or CAD: Part of why I am running now and not closer to the gift-giving-Christmas-season, is that paper prices are increasing and I wanted to keep my current quote locked down.

•Project TOO successful-could cause shipping delays: Seriously, depending on how many backers we get, I may need to hire some outside help for packaging and shipping orders. I am pretty committed to getting these puzzles out as quickly as I get them, but the one-man-band artist that I am can only do so much. I can guarantee that you will have your puzzles by Christmas though!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

You don't need to do any maths right now. Shipping will be collected later. The chart is there for transparency. I want you to know upfront what shipping will cost.

campaign.story:
They Call Her...The Dancer is a story that focuses on the beauty and brutality of dance and martial arts, delving into the morally gray psyche of a professional dancer and assassin.

At first glance, They Call Her…The Dancer is about analyzing the similarities and differences between dance and martial arts. Dance is something that is seen as beautiful, but many don’t think about the pain that is done to one’s body to truly be a dancer. Martial arts are thought of as violent because it’s a form of “fighting”, but there’s also a dance like quality to this work of art.
But once you dig deeper, the reader will quickly realize that The Dancer is actually a story about mental health. Mia is forced to face her own childhood trauma of witnessing her parents’ murder when she becomes the enemy that she once dedicated her life to fight against. The Dancer is a morally gray story that shows that good and evil aren’t so black and white.
With They Call Her...The Dancer #1, you get...
A 22-page, stapled, standard sized comic book printed by Comic Impressions,
including a Black & White edition
and FOR THE FIRST TIME also in COLOR! 
 5 Covers to choose from, including a limited Kickstarter Exclusive FOIL cover!
 Here's what comic book critics and pros are saying about THE DANCER:
Kat at comic conventions way back when those were a thing...
They Call Her...The Dancer #1 COVER A
Cover B - Perfect Blue Homage - Saw Nai Mon
When brainstorming variants for The Dancer, I knew I wanted something to showcase the shattering of 2 identities. Mia can’t be a fully formed person because she still has one foot in the past. The anime film Perfect Blue goes through similar themes of identity, and its movie poster was a perfect homage for our premiere issue.
Saw Nai Mon is an Animator/Illustrator and has graduated from LASALLE College of the Arts (Singapore) with a Diploma in Animation. He is currently working as a Character Concept Artist for both comic and animated film. As an artist, Saw enjoys illustrating outdoor backgrounds as it gives him an ideal visual of stories and characters that he would love to further develop.
Art Station: https://www.artstation.com/dear_saw/profile
Cover C - Two Identities – Vinicius Goro
Vinicius Goro is a digital artist from Brazil, currently working as an illustrator and concept artist in video games.
Art Station: https://www.artstation.com/viniciusgoro/albums/all
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/viniciusgoro/?hl=en
Cover D - Slice and Dice – PapurrCat
A small homage to Uncanny X-Men #207.
Linnéa AKA PapuurCat is a 2D artist best known for her artwork of female TV heroines that she shares to her large, loyal twitter following.
Twitter: https://twitter.com/PapurrCat
Pages from The Dancer #1 that highlight both emotion and action!
PG 6
PG 7
PG 8
PG 18

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ComicUno 
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/haydenclaireheroes/videos 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ev_cantada
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/e.cantada/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/dannyfsch/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/memphisdigitalcomic/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/lastemberpress/ 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/brantfowler
Cross Promotion
The Dusk 
Back up both The Dusk and The Dancer for a crossover print by EV Cantada.
Digital backers of both campaigns will receive a digital version of the print, and physical backers of both campaigns will receive a physical version.
And one lucky physical backer will receive the print SIGNED by both me (the writer/creator of The Dancer) and Alex (the writer/creator of Dusk)! 
Cover A - Rafi de Sousa (Interior Artist)
 Haunting #1-3
If you back both HAUNTING #1-3 and The Dancer #1 at any pledge level (even just $1!), you'll receive an EXCLUSIVE PREVIEW of an upcoming 43-page crossover one shot between Phil Falco's HAUNTING and my superhero comic Like Father, Like Daughter.
You can find out more here. Or just head straight over to the Haunting Kickstarter page!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've attempted to manage all of the risks associated with this project by doing most of the leg work before this campaign's launch so that we could ensure that we continue to deliver immediately after the campaign. As we did with our previous Kickstarters we will consistently update backers and supporters with any issues that may potentially cause delays in the completion of this project and make the necessary adjustments to resolve those matters quickly and efficiently. We understand the importance of fulfilling our promises and always ensure that all of our supporters receive their rewards. And we always find ways to sneak extra swag into our reward packages as a thank you for the patience in supporting our projects on the front end and patiently waiting for them to be completed and delivered....so we can focus on the fun part.....making comics!!! It's because of your continued support that we are able to make these AWESOME comics! And for that we truly appreciate ALL of our backers and keep a wide open form of communication for you all to reach us at any time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Print Update + HAUNTING/Like Father, Like Daughter Crossover #1 LAUNCHES May 24th!
updates.update_content:
The comic is at the printer! Their estimated due date is 5/21. It usually takes about 2 weeks to ship - so I'm hoping to have books by the end of May/beginning of June. Once I get the books in my hands that same week I'll begin shipping and fulfilling. So we are exactly on schedule, which is great! 
The audio commentary will also be sent out in the next few weeks.
Onto some more exciting news! My writing partner (Phil Falco) and I are launching a new Kickstarter May 24th.

updates.update_userinfo: The Dancer #1 Digital Copy In Your Inbox
updates.update_content:
I'm so excited to report that the digital copy of The Dancer #1 is in your Kickstarter inbox. I can't wait to hear your thoughts on the issue. 
More stretch goal items are in your inbox as well with the first script of The Dancer #1 and A FIVE PAGE preview of the next issue. 
Audio commentary coming soon. We just put the order in for the print copies of the book. So I hope to have the books in my hand sometime this month to start shipping out.
Other Kickstarters To Back

updates.update_userinfo: Most Successful Campaign to Date - THANK YOU!!
updates.update_content:
I just wanted to take a minute and thank everyone who helped bring The Dancer #1 to life! With over 500+ backers and a five figure campaign, The Dancer is my most successful campaign to date.
In the next few weeks watch this space for updates on rewards. We are looking to wrap digital and physical fulfillment by May/June.  
Other Kickstarters To Back

We are less than 24 hours away from wrapping the campaign with all Backer Goals unlocked, but we have 1 more stretch goal we'd love to unlock. If we make it 10K before the end of the campaign every backer will receive a 5 page colored preview of The Dancer #2.

updates.update_userinfo: Third Stretch Goal Has Been Unlocked
updates.update_content:
We've officially reached $8,000!! That means all backers will receive the digital version of The Dancer #1 script. Our next stretch goal is $9,000. If we reach to this goal then every backer will receive a digital copy of my other comic book Like Father, Like Daughter #1.
"A high school girl, Casey Ryder, inherits the very powers that made her superhero father leave their family."
If you'd like the whole run thus far, there are add ons for both the digital and physical catch up of the book.

We've officially unlocked the second stretch goal - an audio commentary for the first issue, and if we reach $8,000 then ALL BACKERS will receive a digital version of The Dancer #1 script. 
Onto other news. If you enjoy Kickstarter talk. I'll be LIVE on my YouTube channel at 8 PM EST with Alex Segura of The Dusk to discuss his campaign.

campaign.story:
About this Kickstarter 

In this campaign we are offering the the first prints of our three newest puzzles at a very reasonable $15/puzzle plus shipping; that's 50% the retail price! Due to a printing mishap, these puzzles were printed with a border around the image. They're still very beautiful and the same high quality as all of our puzzles, but not how we designed them.  If you don't mind borders around puzzles, then this is your chance to get them at half price. And if you plan to frame them, you won’t notice the border.
Reward tiers are broken down into two shipping options: 'US' and 'EU & ROW' with 'EU & ROW' supplies very limited (World Tree is sold out in the EU & ROW-Sorry). Reward options for US backers include: single puzzles, a double pack (any two of your choice) and a triple pack.

What We’re Offering
1000 Piece Jigsaw Puzzles -  With Borders: Red Dragonfly in Otaki, World Tree and Lamb of God.
Exact Puzzle Dimensions: 27.63" x 19.63" (70.18 cm x 49.86 cm).
Each puzzle comes in a Limited Edition box: 14 5/8" x 10 5/8" x 2 1/8" (37.16 cm x 27 cm x 6.68 cm).
Each puzzle and box has a textured linen finish, featuring pristine imagery with bright, bold, and beautiful colors.
Manufactured in Europe with the highest quality materials.
What ALL Backers NEED to Know About Shipping
All backers, regardless of where you live, will be charged shipping. See Chart below. Please be well informed before making  your pledge. All US orders will be shipped by us. All International orders will be shipped by our fulfillment partner in Germany.
We are very happy to announce that we are finally able to offer tracking on ALL shipments worldwide, including single puzzle shipments! This is great news, especially in these crazy times, when the incidents of lost and stolen packages are on the rise. *Light tracking - Packages are scanned at pickup and when package is out for delivery.
Customs Fees - We're Going to Be Honest Here
Please know that all backers are responsible for paying any duties and taxes charged by customs. If your package is returned to us because you do not pay these fees, we will not refund your pledge since we will be charged an additional fee for the return shipping. We ask that you keep this in mind when making your pledge.
Missing Piece Policy: PLEASE READ!
Have you been visited by the piece thief?
Rather than tell us in the comments, please send an email to pgpuzzles.contact@gmail.com specifying the title of the puzzle and number of missing pieces. Please be sure to include the following information:
attached photo or photos of the entire puzzle clearly showing where the piece is missing
your mailing address 
where you bought the puzzle or if it was a gift
Who Are We?
We are Eric and Lara Andersen, owners of Playing Grounded, a somewhat trendy but thoroughly unique jigsaw puzzle company that offers a small  but wonderful collection of artworks by tremendously talented artists  geared toward teens, young adults, and the youthful minded. We select art that is colorful, energetic, and alluring without being overly provocative or offensive in any way, so they can be enjoyed by practically anyone.
From the moment you hold a Playing Grounded puzzle box in your hands, you’ll feel the difference. From the quality of our boxes, to the perfect fit of our pieces, we want your experience with our puzzles to leave memorable moments.
Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since we have the puzzles in stock, we're ready to start fulfillment at the conclusion of this Kickstarter. There don't seem to be as many delays with shipping as there were in previous months, so we don't foresee any issues. However, with some countries still on lockdown. there might be some new restrictions put into place in the coming months. We'll keep you posted.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Our puzzles are made with high quality materials that will last a lifetime if well cared for. Store in a dry area free of direct sunlight.
Reusability and recyclability
Our puzzles are collectors’ items. The boxes are made of thick sturdy cardboard that can be used to store your puzzles or other various items. They're attractive enough to display on a bookshelf, and they also make a great place for kitties and other furry friends to cozy up in.

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
We just wanted you all to know that your rewards have shipped!  If you didn't receive the email with your tracking info, please let us know so we can resend that. And, if you are the one backer who didn't fill out the survey, please do so ASAP. 
We hope you all enjoy your puzzles! Thank you again for making this campaign a success. =D

Hey Everyone,
Happy Saturday! Thanks to each and everyone of you who stuck with us through this campaign! We were able to raise enough to make a nice dent in our shipping/logistics bill, and you got the rare opportunity to get our puzzles as such a low price. All in all, we're really pleased with the result, and we're looking forward to starting fulfillment.

Add-ons

Hey Everyone!
We're off to a great start! Thanks to you all, we not only reached our goal in 24 hours, but we're now 182% funded!! 
As it stands, we've hit our limit for the World Tree puzzles for international backers. We're thrilled that you all seem to like that one. We've still got plenty left in the US, so if you have any friends or fellow Kickstarters who might be interested, or if you're part of any puzzle groups, : . We need all the support that we can get!

campaign.story:
From the creator of the hit comic series, PLUME, now comes the third and final volume of K. Lynn Smith's new series FOR GOODNESS' SAKE.
For Goodness' Sake is about a guy named Thatcher, who turns more demonic every time he's a turd-- which is often--and the free-spirited Rayne who's trying to cure him of this curse.  But they soon learn there is more to all this than what they had thought, that there's a deeper, darker secret that binds it all together.

This Kickstarter will help bring the full story to print.  This title is entirely self-published, so only with the help of Kickstarter and its backers can I make this baby come to life. Scroll below to see all the goods offered.
Volume 3 will be a trade paperback, 100 pages in length.

The first and second books are available through the Add-on feature! Or get the whole bundle at a discount tier!

 Use the "Add-on" Feature to your tier (physical rewards only) to include a commission and/or a pin!
Get a full-color commission of any single subject you want (you, your pet, an established character, etc...), available under the 'add-ons'!
Pin 'dat Pup!
NEW ADD-ON: SLIPCASE FOR ALL THREE VOLUMES** 
**PLEASE NOTE: This will only fit the reprinted Volume one. The first print is too large. Sorry for the inconvenience!

Get yo' face in this piece!





UNLOCKED: Downloadable Digital Wallpaper
UNLOCKED: Double-sided bookmark






Follow K. Lynn Smith on:
Twitter  ||  Instagram  ||  Facebook  ||  klynnsmith.net
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Human error as well as technological errors are always possible, such as software malfunctions, printing delays, shipping delays and just plain ol' miscommunications. Hell, even a pandemic could occur. I'm fully committed to this campaign and its fulfillment, but be easy on me. I'm just one human with a small group of help, who I've bribed with food and alcohol.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
