campaign.story:
$2,000 Milestone Unlocked!
Black Friday / Small Business Saturday Bonuses

"No story lives unless someone wants to listen........." 
Weʻve been listening to stories all our lives. Whether itʻs sitting with our loved ones at family gatherings, or sitting in the classroom listening to a teacher attempting to convince us of the relevance of historical figures. Stories keep culture and people alive, often providing a timeless link to our ancient traditions, myths, legends, hopes, and dreams. Stories also help us understand ourselves and the world around us. 
BUT.... what happens if the stories that weʻre told exclude us?  
A single story, a single ruling perspective creates stereotypes and perceptions that anything else is not important. When that one story becomes the only story, people start to question their existence and humanity. It is disempowering to anyone who does not fit the ruling stereotype. The problem with stereotypes is not that they are untrue, but that they are incomplete. They make one story become the only story that matters.
The Moana Nui podcast is a safe haven for authentic storytelling and a space where humans from all walks of life can engage in thoughtful conversations. Listeners will get to hear the other side of history (his-story) and explore the beauty of indigenous cultures from around the world. We celebrate and empower the silenced voices of our ancestors and their accomplishments, while inspiring their descendants who keep their legacies alive.
Every culture has its own stories or narratives, which are shared as a means of entertainment, education, cultural preservation or instilling moral values.
Storytelling forges connections between people and ideas. Stories convey the culture, history, and values that unite people. Stories build familiarity and help all of us to step into the shoes of another person and see things from their point of view. 

The Moana Nui Podcast will be hosted by writer/creator/designer Moana McAdams and will make its home on Podbean with extended availablility on Apple Podcast, Spotify, and Google.
Moana McAdams, Host
Podbean Hosting Fees
Editing Services
Shipping Costs
Reward Production
Official Moana Nui USB
Kids Club tier - $50
Lock-In Your Special Guest Appearance on Season 2
16 x 30 Canvas Art - $89
Weʻll Come Up With Questions Together & Have Some Fun!
Personalized Consulting with Moana
Official Moana Nui Hoodie
Official Moana Nui Mask
Allen Carter is an artist, writer, promoter, and the sole creator of two independent comics titles called Damn Tourists and Cosmic Force. He lives in Los Angeles, but is originally from Hawaiʻi. Allen tells us how his favorite childhood cartoons inspired him to create words of his own that were inspired by his special places in Hawaiʻi. Allen also shares his thoughts on the Black Lives Matter Movement and how we can be good allies to the people and the cause. 
Allen Carter
Alika Seki is the owner and operator of Maui Comics. He talks with us about the importance of serving your community, particularly in challenging times like what the world is experiencing with COIVD. Alika is a champion for the people of Hawaii and the work ethic many natives possess to thrive and survive the high costs of paradise.
Alika Seki - Mauiʻs Hometown Hero
Alika Naihe is an artist, game designer, educator, and owner of Hauʻoli Art. Recreating the Legends of Hawaiʻi. Alika masterfully shares his history and culture by taking images, stories and concepts out of museums and into daily life. His broader work and a coach and mentor for Hawaiʻiʻs teens embodies the spirit of the Moana Nui podcast and our ancestors.
Alika Naihe
Brian Lambert - Brian Joseph Lambert is the award-winning, lead contributing writer at Wingless Entertainment.  He specializes in bringing diversity to action/adventure, fantasy and sci-fi worlds. When not writing or editing, Brian works on creating a functioning lightsaber, so that he can pass the Jedi Trials.
Brian Lambert
Chris Koanui is a police officer for the Honolulu Police Department, an artist, colorist, and creator of the Nightmarcher comic book. The Nightmarcher saga begins with a ghost resurrecting a fallen Hawaiian soldier. It's a tale that twists fantasy and Hawaiian mythology with mystery and humor in the setting of modern Oahu.
Chris Koanui
Crown Shepherd is an emerging fiction, picture book, and comic book writer, and author of Black Boy, Black Boy. Her writing is a result of her surroundings and upbringing. She has always been deeply rooted in literature and writing, but it wasn’t until she found more writers that look like her that her writing soared. As someone from an underrepresented community, Crown knows what it means to have representation feed your creativity. The stories she wants to share are aimed at giving a voice to the voiceless.
Crown Shepherd
DJ Keawekane is a creator, writer, and artist who was on Oʻahu, but moved to Hilo very early on and graduated from Hilo High School. He began drawing at age five and always wanted to go into comics, but never knew how. At 18, he stopped drawing until he got into a bad car accident which broke his spine in 3 places. With lots of time in recovery, DJ rekindled his love for art and began his creator-owned comic, Exillion: Creed of the Knightenhawke. DJ created the beautiful canvas art rewards for this campaign.
DJ Keawekane
Dominic Acol is an Oʻahu born, Kona raised artist, woodworker, and owner of Mauloa Haʻawina Designs where he captures the spirit of his familyʻs cherished moments and brings them to life through art. Each handmade piece uniquely depicts the spirit of his ʻohana way of life that bonds the past and future, preserving time until it can be passed down to the next generation.
Dominic Acol
Dorphise Jean is the writer/creator of Spiritʻs Destiny and owner of Gente Entertainment. She aims to give readers of all ages stories and influences that encourage them to learn more about their cultural roots.
Dorphise Jean
Greg Burnham is an author/writer, editor, publisher, and history buff. Greg has been writing professionally for nearly a decade. He makes up one half of the Tuskegee Heirs duo. With projects like The Search For Sadiqah, Broken Glass and Grandpa’s shoes under his belt, Greg recently made the transition to full time writer/publisher. He’s currently working on a bevy of projects, as well as the beloved Tuskegee Heirs. 
Greg Burnham
Jon "Free" was born and raised on Oʻahu and relocated to Las Vegas where he started a publishing company, Live Free Die Free (LFDF) Comics, to produce creator owned properties, including his own title, The Contraptor.  Free has done multiple covers and internal pages for various independent comic companies including, Onward! Comics (Avenger Red), Self Employed Comics (The Cule), The Squeeg Comics (The Skilled Apprentice), KipsWorld Comics (D'Mitri), and Thunderfrog Studios (Gemini Storm), to name a few.
Jon "Free" Isabelo
Lawrence James King is the Strongest Man I Know, CEO and Owner of Constant Hustle Comics, and the writer and creator of the comics Avery the Amazing and The Last Line. 
Lawrence James King
Newton Lilavois, a comic book writer and publisher of Dream Fury Comics, was born in Port-au-Prince, Haiti and grew up in Brooklyn, NYC. When Newton is not writing computer code as an IT consultant, he's writing stories for graphic novels and comic books. He currently resides in the Bronx with his wife, two daughters, and their chocolate lab. Newton recently raised over $25K here on Kickstarter for his creator-owned comic Crescent City Monsters.
Newton Lilavois
Patrick Strange does it all. He is the host & executive producer of the weekly YouTube pop culture show,New Release Wednesday. Patrick is also the founder of the charity cosplay organization, CosLove, which promotes self-expression and creativity while supporting communities via family events and regular visits to schools and hospitals nationwide.
Patrick Michael Strange aka Kuya P
Taylor "TJ" Sterling was born in Grand Rapids, Michigan. At an early age he displayed a very keen and almost prodigious talent for art. In the late 1980’s, TJ took a serious interest in drawing comic books and superheroes. After graduating college, working at Marvel and doing some cover work for Dark Horse Comics, TJ started his own company, RAE Comics. TJ recently raised over $20K here on Kickstarter for his flagship book, OKEMUS.
TJ Sterling
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have successfully funded and fulfilled 2 campaigns here on Kickstarter with the help of almost 300 total backers. We are committed to ensuring we deliver on our campaign promises.

All episodes for the launch of Season 1 have been recorded and are just about ready for our listeners! The main risks to our project are potential prolonged shipping timelines due to holiday traffic, USPS stability, and COVID factors. 

Our intent is to keep our backers happy and we will keep you all updated as fulfillment progresses. Reach out anytime with questions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Womenʻs Day! Special LIVE Panel in 30 mins!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backer Fam - 
By now, most of you should have received your physical rewards. We are in the process of sending out digital rewards also, apologize for a slight delay there as we had some computer issues and had to get all of our files resituated. If you have not received your items or have any issues with them, please let us know.
Also, if youʻre free this evening, please join us as we celebrate International Womenʻs Day with this amazing panel of women to discuss the value of creating a culture of equity & inclusion along with the unseen warriors that are continuing to break down barriers during this pivotal time of change.

Aloha backer fam!
Most of you should have received your physical and digital rewards by now. There are a few packages we are holding until we get shipping information from your surveys. So, if you have not filled yours out, please do so asap so we can deliver the goods! If anyone is missing rewards or items from your selected tier, let us know and we will make it right!

Hi everyone! Weʻre getting to our final stages of editing and prepping our episodes for the official launch on Podbean soon. But first, we take care of our Kickstarter backers! Once all files have final edits, we will place our orders for custom USBs. Iʻm really excited because the vendor we are using will pre-load the files on their end so that once the USBs arrive in the mail, we can turn them around quickly and get them out to each of you!

updates.update_userinfo: Next Steps + Happy New Year + Surveys
updates.update_content:
Aloha backers!
Hope you and your family had a wonderful holiday! As 2020 finally comes to a close, we wanted to provide you with an update and the next steps we are taking for the podcast.

updates.update_userinfo: Only 4 hours left + Just $339 away from Sticker Swag!!
updates.update_content:
Weʻre coming in HOT into the final hours of this campaign! I canʻt say it enough...THANK YOU SOOOO MUCH!! Mahalo NUI!  This campaign has exceeded our expecations and we are SUPER grateful to all of you. We wanna finish this STRONG!  So.... at $3K we want to give everyone awesome Moana Nui sticker swag!!!
We are only $339 away reaching that. Please help us by SHARING one last time! I know we can do it!

updates.update_userinfo: Only 2 days left + A Bonus Episode
updates.update_content:
Aloha backer fam! Wow, this Quickstarter has sped by and we only have a little over 2 days left. Weʻre so grateful that for your belief in us, in this project, and in the power of our community! Words canʻt express our appreciation enough so we decided to do a very special BONUS episode for all of you!  
Tomorrow, Dec 10 at 7pm EST, we are broadcasting a special episode on the #MoanaNuiPodcast with special guest, Afua Richardson - artist, illustrator, singer, songwriter, and my shero!! Iʻm so excited for this opportunity to sit down and chat with Afua about her successful career in comics and film. Iʻm humbled to have this chance to get a closer look at all of the wonderful things she has done and get to know her on a more personal level.

Hey backer fam!
Itʻs been a great few days on the campaign. Weʻre already 222% funded and rolled through the $2,000 milestone!  So...thanks to all of you, we have UNLOCKED a new bonus!  All backers will receive a beautiful piece of chibi art that captures Mike Watsonʻs take on the #MoanaNuiPodcast logo. Itʻs very cool and playful and Iʻm excited to be able to share it with each of you. Backers with digital tiers will receive a digital wallpaper. Physical backers will get a print!

Hey guys and gals! Thank you so much for helping us get off to a NUI (big) start! Iʻll be fully transparent with you - I was super nervous to launch on Black Friday. My initial plan was to launch the week before, but it took longer than expected to get our project approved. So we had to pivot a bit at the last minute, and it actually worked out for the best because it gave us more time to give you guys the best campaign possible, despite the challenges are ALL dealing with this year!  
With your help and support, we reached our goal in less than four hours!!! It was a such a pleasant surprise! THANK YOU, MAHALO on behalf of the Burning Spear team and all of our Season 1 guests! Kickstarter backers have helped bring so many UNIQUE and AMAZING projects to life. We are honored to be amongst that list!

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Michael Avon Oeming Eisner and Harvey award winning comic book artist and writer, best known as the co-creator of Powers with Brian Michael Bendis, as well as Marvel's THOR: Ragnarok, Red Sonja and Cave Carson with Gerard Way.
This is a Kickstarter for my project, the AFTER REALM - an ongoing quarterly series -- each issue is double sized, written and drawn by me. Colors by Taki Soma and letters by Shawn Lee - The team that brought you Dick Tracy: Forever.
This fourth issue will be exclusively available on Kickstarter; this is our first foray of publishing without Image comics. This is exciting for us as well as daunting, but we are up to the challenge! We expect some growing pains, but we will do our best to keep it minimal - for example, we are giving ourselves more time for printing and shipping - and this will be our first time using ADD-ONS!!!
THE AFTER REALM:
Besides my love of Mythology, the After Realm is also inspired by my love of Saturday morning cartoons from the 80's, like Thundarr the Barbarian and obviously Dungeons and Dragons. This will be a dangerous but fun series filled with my childhood inspirations.
The After Realm is about Oona Lightfoot, an Elf torn away from her best friend at the beginning of Ragnarok and the destruction of the Nine Realms.
She struggles to find her friend to fulfill a promise they made about exploring the Nine Realms.
After saving her people from Loki, Oona sets out to explore those new worlds and record what has become of them,  and to record what happened to the Old Gods and the new peoples that inhabit it.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 4th campaign for The After Realm, and we've learned a lot! And now, we are going to publish it ourselves, adding to the learning curve we felt as if we were catching up on. 
Printing, handling, storage and direct market are all going to be new challenges we are taking on and will learn from. We always appreciate backers support and patience and we will never take that for granted. We are doing our best to prepare for any challenges to come. 
Of course you'll be notified and updated if something will prevent us from fulfilling our promise to you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Well not really, but a friend of mine, Sean McManus created our next Kickstarter video. This will even serve as an Evergreen video, giving audiences a sort of wide look at the comic and the feel of it. We aren’t releasing it until the launch of issue 5, so this is for your eyes only, Rangers!
Be sure to check out Superman: Worlds of War Future State for a 20 page Midnighter story and starting in Action Comics 1029 Taki and I have 8 page Midnighter stories written by Becky Cloonan and Michael Conrad for 8 issues. It’s in a much more detailed style than I usually work in, but it’s fun, be sure to check those out.

Hey Rangers! A brief update: Issue 4 is beginning to ship! We are also listening to your feedback and starting with issue 5, we'll bag and board with shipping.  I’ll also begin shipping out the art rewards this month. Here is a pic posted by our fellow Ranger Rick Reason!

Word is we should be getting our printed copies of After Realm 4 this coming week- our first time printing ourselves! 
I've been working on a bunch of things, a few projects happened to collide together. I did a single issue of Midnighter for DC's Future State, working on a series of 8 page Midnighter stories for Action Comics, The After Realm, a Graphic Novel I'm writing for Victor Santos, an Old Guard Story and an ongoing unannounced project- whew!

I recorded a making of video which I'll post tomorrow. I wanted you Rangers to see the art first:) Happy New year!
M!

Once again, so happy and grateful you've all come through for Oona and Pooka!  I'm off to work on our magnet stretch goal and will post that art and hopefully a video to go along with it. I'm going to keep this brief so I can get to work and the next steps. From the bottom of my heart, thank you!

See you next update!

We are funded! 
Thank you, Rangers! We have a week left, so for this stretch goal I thought we could use something new- I’ll create a new Oona drawing for a 2x3.5 magnet for your fridge! Let’s hit 9K and everyone who got a physical reward will get one!
I’d also like to take a moment to REALLY thank you. Not just “hey thanks!” but to really let you know how much your support means to me, especially on the After Realm. This project has become so personal. I mean at his point I’ve written a deceased family member into the story, does it get much more personal than that? I love that I don’t have to tailor this book to the industry, I can just let it be the daydream I’ve always wanted it to be. So excited for issue 4, we really set up some things that will pay of HUGE in issue 5! Thank you!

ORIGINAL ART
THREE NEW ORIGINAL ART TIERS has been added, they are the last ones for this campaign. One of the art pieces is the one used for the book mark and pin-up in a promotion which is one of my favorites. The others are pages from issue 3. Check out this handy little video I made😊

NOW AND TOMORROW
Hey gang, we are nearing the halfway mark and I wanted to thank you for such a strong launch during these hard times. I’m certain we’ll hit our goal, but now that we are on our 4th Campaign, I need your help in deciding what our stretch goals will be. Did you like the One Page Story Poster? What about new stickers? I want the goals to be exciting for YOU! So let me know, I’m open to suggestions.

updates.update_userinfo: After Realm #4 launch is a success!
updates.update_content:
THANK YOU! Wow, here we are, launching the 4th kickstarter! We were 50% funded in less than 24 hours, I thank you from the bottom of my heart! What does the future hold? Issue 5 will be the last issue of this first arc. From there, I'm going to do these as stand alone graphic novels twice a year. This will allow us to stay on top of shipping and streamline the whole experience for everyone.
Some books and rewards for issue 3 are still going out. I miscounted some posters and we needed our complete t-shirt surveys to be filled out. But as many of you have reached out to ask for your packages, you know I'm doing my best to get back to you and keep you informed.

campaign.story:
Demons are real. 
They pop in and out of time spreading discord and strife. Any change they cause could destroy history as we know it.

A group of time traveling soldiers stands against them. They call themselves The Toxic Fruit.
Their battle has been waged for many years, but they've never faced anything like this: 
What are We Making?
The funds raised from this Kickstarter campaign will be used to print both the 11th and 12th issue of our fantasy comic series Tart. 
In Tart 11, the two newest recruits are taken on one last training mission before they join the fight. Their task: infiltrate Nazi Germany during the 1936 Berlin Olympics.
Tart 11
Please note: Due to the setting, images associated with the Third Reich will be seen in this issue prominently. We are making the choice not to share them in this campaign, but do not want any backers to be surprised when they receive their books.

In Tart 12, the entire Toxic Fruit Organization must band together to try to repel The son of the King of Hell. 
Tart 12
A total of 52 brand new pages of Time traveling, demon hunting adventure.
Two new issues delivered together to maximize shipping costs.
An issue of stealth, followed by an issue of all out war.
A brand new Enamel Pin starring the First Lady of The Toxic Universe: 
Tart Acid!

How can I Catch Up?
If you are just learning about Tart, please don't be worried about being late to the party. Our previous backers have always supported us so passionately that we were able to print enough first edition copies of our comics that we have a bundle for you.

The Catch Up Tier includes the Tart Volume 1 trade paperback (collecting issues 1-3), and individual issues of Tart 4-12. 

If you've been waiting to catch up on Tart, don't wait much longer. We are starting to run low on some of our first editions copies of Tart and can not promise we'll be able to offer this in the future.

Want to know more about our series before you pledge? We'll do better than that. You can know almost EVERYTHING about our series. Tart 1-10 are available to read for free right now at:

READ IT. IF YOU LOVE IT, BACK IT!!! 
What Our Peers Say about Tart
Who Makes Tart?
Why are we Returning to Kickstarter?
Our series has found our most passionate and supportive audience here on Kickstarter. It is not an exaggeration to say that we might not have been able to continue if not for those readers who found us and return again and again.

We want to continue giving that audience "first dibs" at our comics to repay that support. It has been asked of us if any other series has been on the platform longer than Tart, and we honestly don't know. But we are proud to have gotten ten issues into the world with the Kickstarter Community. We're going to be thrilled to hit an even dozen when this campaign is funded.

As always with our campaigns, this project is 100% ready to go. We never launch Kickstarters without all interior art completed, because delivering on-time is extremely important to us.

The funds raised in this campaign will go directly to printing enough issues of Tart 11 and 12 to fulfill this campaign and have issues left over for the convention circuit (when that resumes), create the Tart Acid Enamel Pin, and pay for shipping those rewards to our backers.

Any additional funds raised will go toward the interior artwork of Tart 13 which is already underway.

Reward Tiers 

Thank You! It's time to KICKSTART MY TART!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges? This is 2020. Everything is a Risk and a Challenge. But we have run 9 previous Kickstarter campaigns and delivered on all nine. We promise communicate with our backers immediately and if and when any issues that come up.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Bare Bones Digital Tier
support.descp:
If you're a digital reader who is all caught up with Tart, this is the tier for you. You will get a PDF of issues 11 & 12 to stay up to date on all of Tart Acid's adventures. We call these rewards the Bare Bones PDF, because they do not come with the Script or Commentary sections you will find in the next tier.
INCLUDES:
Bare Bones PDF Tart #11
Bare Bones PDF Tart #12

support.title: DVD Commentary PDFs of Tart 11 & 12
support.descp:
Ludo and Kevin enjoy going back through the first drafts of the script to see how each issue of Tart grows and changes through the creation process. We comment about why things were changed and/or what we were trying to achieve with moments in the comic. Don't worry, we black out any portions of the script that might spoil upcoming events in the series.
INCLUDES:
Tart 11 DVD Commentary PDF
Tart 12 DVD Commentary PDF

support.title: TART Digital Bundle
support.descp:
Get PDFs of all 12 issues of Tart and the Hell Strawberry trade paperback written and illustrated by Ludovic Salle'. This is over 300 pages of Toxic fun for $12. We also reach out to our friends in the Indie Comic Community to share other cool books you might love free within this bundle.
INCLUDES:
Tart Digital Bundle

support.title: You back, We hold
support.descp:
With International Shipping as expensive as it is, we understand that some backers would prefer to bundle multiple issues of our comic and pay shipping all at once. With this tier, we will print and hold a copy of your comic until you make arrangements with us to send them or (we hope at some future safe time) meet up in person at a show or comic shop for an in person hand off. Please remember that shipping costs are not stable and so far have never gone down while you make the decision to do this.
INCLUDES:
Tart 11 Physical Copy
Tart 12 Physical Copy
Tart Digital Bundle

support.title: Let's get physical - Media Mail Shipping
support.descp:
This tier is for our readers who are all caught up and just need Tart 11 and 12, the newest books printed with funds from this campaign. To give our backers control of how much they pay, and how protected their books are we are giving two shipping options. This tier will be packed in a flat, hard envelope and shipped Medial Mail to save on shipping. Please do not choose this tier if your primary concern is the books arriving in mint condition. International Shippers, Please note that we are only shipping Priority International so please pledge the next tier to receive your rewards outside of the United States.
INCLUDES:
Tart 11 Physical Copy
Tart 12 Physical Copy
Tart Digital Bundle
US Shipping included in Pledge Price

support.title: Let's get Physical - Priority Shipping
support.descp:
This tier is for our readers who are all caught up and just need Tart 11 and 12, the newest books printed with funds from this campaign. To give our backers control of how much they pay, and how protected their books are we are giving two shipping options. This tier will be packed in Comic Flash Mailers for maximum safety, and shipped US Priority Shipping for speed and tracking.
INCLUDES:
Tart 11 Physical Copy
Tart 12 Physical Copy
Tart Digital Bundle
US Shipping included in Pledge Price

support.title: Tart Acid Signature Enamel Pin
support.descp:
We've been holding out until a special occasion to release an enamel pin of the star of our Show Tart Acid. With Tart 11 and 12 completing the second season of Tart, we wanted to go out in style. This pin will be at least 1.5 inches in diameter, but we'll be shooting to provide a 2 inch pin depending on stretch goals! US Shipping included in price.
INCLUDES:
Tart Acid Enamel Pin
Tart 11 Physical Copy
Tart 12 Physical Copy
Tart Digital Bundle
US Shipping included in Pledge Price

support.title: Catch Up Tier
support.descp:
If you're just hearing about us you can still get the entire run of Kechal Comics First Editions of Tart. Since Tart 2 & 3 have never (YET!) been printed as stand alone issues, this tier comes with the Tart Volume 1 trade paperback which collects issues 1-3, and then individual issues of Tart 4-12. We are running out of some of these issues, so act now before the option is no longer available.
INCLUDES:
Tart Volume 1 TPB
Tart 4
Tart 5
Tart 6
Tart 7
Tart 8
Tart 9
Tart 10

US Shipping included in Pledge Price

support.title: Virgin Variant Covers of Tart 11 and 12
support.descp:
We had so much fun with our Virgin Variant for Tart #10 that we decided to bring the reward back for this campaign.
INCLUDES:
Tart 11 Physical Copy
Tart 12 Physical Copy
Tart 11 Virgin Cover
Tart 12 Virgin Cover
Tart Acid Enamel Pin
Tart Digital Bundle
US Shipping included in Pledge Price

support.title: Ludovic Salle' Original Sketch
support.descp:
Ludo has sketched our some of our Toxic Fruit in various time periods and costumes. the sketches are black and white pencil and ink illustrations with grey tones added {LUDO - HOW WAS THIS DONE} on on 9 1/2" x 6 1/2" pages. To save delivery time, these sketches have already been completed and will be distributed randomly to backers. This tier includes the regular Kickstarter edition of Tart 11 and 12, the enamel pin and both Virgin covers.
INCLUDES:
original Art

support.title: Be our Cover Model
support.descp:
You can star with Tart on the Kechal Comics edition of Tart #13 when it comes out next year. If you back this reward, Ludo will use your likeness prominently on the cover. We do not have final say on our covers for Scout Comic Editions so we can not make any promises that you will be on the cover that ends up in your Local Comic Shop. Along with this future honor you get all previous rewards from the campaign. We'll also add ten copies of Tart 13 to your pledge for that campaign (remind Kevin!!!) so you can give them out to friends and family.
INCLUDES:
Be Drawn onto Tart 13's Ccver

original Art

updates.update_userinfo: Tart 13 is just around the corner!
updates.update_content:
Hello! 
I'm excited to share with you that the next chapter of Tart will be launching on Kickstarter this month.

updates.update_userinfo: Doing the Happy Dance, Feeling the Flow
updates.update_content:
I'm celebrating tonight because The Tart 1-12 Kickstarter campaign is fulfilled.*
* I messaged a few backers today that I need more information on, but aside from them, every package going to a backer receiving physical rewards has left my home.
This is going to be short and sweet because

So far, every reward that does not include the Tart Acid enamel Pin has been sent to its rightful owner. That is, of course, if you've filled out your Crowd Ox surveys. Please contact me if you have filled out your surveys and it hasn't arrived so I can start the investigative process.
As fr the enamel pin, I spoke with the people at Skelton Crew Studio this weekend to get an idea of when I can expect them. They couldn’t pinpoint it exactly, but expected production to be completed by early February.

My guess is that gets them in my hands somewhere in mid or late February. And I’ll, as quickly as I’m able, get them sorted into the remaining rewards waiting to go and off to their loving homes.

I do not expect to miss the March delivery promise on any rewards going out, but I’ll stay in communication if there is an unforeseen hiccup.

I know plan B will be to send the books alone and the pins later if we get too close, but I’d prefer to just pack up once so I can pivot my attention back to writing.

One reward I prepped for 75 of you went out this weekend (but will not be arriving to you until Will Allred is able to deliver his rewards).

The free crossover print starring Tart, and Hank & Hector (from Crossover Division) is on its way to Will to send to every backer who supported both campaigns (and got a physical reward in the Crossover Division campaign).

If you don’t remember it looks like this:

updates.update_userinfo: Packages arriving, Surveys needed and a chance to order Tart in your Local Comic Shop
updates.update_content: The best thing I can say about this first week of January is that you gave me a much needed project to focus on. There have obviously been some doin's aspirin', but because of you I can force myself each day to pull away from the news for a few hours and prepare between 10 and 25 rewards to be dropped off at the Post Office.

updates.update_userinfo: 2021 is starting with a bang because THEY'RE HERE!
updates.update_content:
Tart 11 and 12 are in my home!
Comic Impressions worked extremely hard around the holidays to print them, and it came to a point where I could either drive over and pick them up to begin shipping to you next week, or have them ship it to me and I could start prep last night.
We found a way to make that shipping economical enough to pull the trigger. so instead of driving five hours next week, I drove 45 minutes yesterday.

Did you know December 16th is the birthday of one of the greatest writers of all time?
Yep. You guessed it:

updates.update_userinfo: Tart surveys are being built. Coming soon!
updates.update_content:
I’ve been spending most of my free time over the last week or two working behind the scenes in our fulfillment software trying to prepare the survey and Add On Process. You should see the fruits of these efforts some time this week when I send you the survey emails.

We’re using Crowd Ox this campaign so we can compare them to Backerkit (which we have previously used three times). It’s been a little like learning a new language, but one that is based on your primary one. Like a French Speaker learning Creole or vice versa.

Some of it makes sense. And then I'd hit a brick wall. I've scaled that wall, I think, but without a ton of confidence that I did so correctly.

updates.update_userinfo: Setting up Crowd Ox and deciding on order numbers
updates.update_content:
The campaign is over, but there’s no rest for the wicked!

Before I tell you what I’ve been up to, I want to thank you again for your support. You stepped up for us, and set us up attack 2021 with reckless abandon!

But it takes careful planning to get reckless, and that's what I'm doing now. Since the campaign ended I’ve been sorting the Catch Up Tiers so I can choose exactly how many issues of Tart 11 and 12 to print.

campaign.story:
Welcome to Mina's is Cloudscape's latest anthology all about Vancouver and the people who live in it through the lens of a fictional diner: Mina's. The book was created and edited by Cloudscape board member, Emily Lampson and features heartwarming stories of life, love, and food, all of which connects the stories characters when they enter Mina's.  Some contributors have brought their own experiences to the book and others were inspired about moments throughout the history of Vancouver.  This book features ethnic diversity and represents all walks of life including individuals old and young, LGBTQ and people with disabilities throughout the history of the city we all love. 
Cover art by Carolyn Wong
The anthology starts with Emily Lampson's story about the diner's opening in 1919, coinciding with British Columbian legislation passed which forbade white waitresses from working at Chinese businesses. Liz, a waitress, loses her job due to this law and goes to work at her sister Laura's restaurant, which is named after Liz's daughter Mina.

Welcome to Mina's by Emily Lampson

Welcome to Mina's contains happy stories and tragic ones taking place at the diner throughout the years.  From a delivery man finding forbidden love to curious people passing through on a much longer journey, Mina's is the destination to meet new friends. 

Emily's motivation for assembling Welcome to Mina's is to nurture the creation of more stories that take place in the City of Vancouver. The film industry regularly use Vancouver as a backdrop pretending to be other places, but not often does the city ever play itself. Our city is full of talented writers and artists working in comics, animation, film, video games, prose, and music, but the city itself is not always reflected in the work that we produce. Vancouver is a special place and we're so excited to share with you the lives of Vancouverites in these stories. 
Caught in the Storm by Evan Waterman and Lo Vicente
Welcome to Mina's is edited and curated by Emily Lampson.
A combined effort from talented writers and artists have created a 135 page book of wonderful black and white, grey-scale comics. 

This beautiful cover is drawn by Seeroro - Carolyn Wong with stories written and drawn by

Of the money we need, 65% is going to the creators for their page rates. 23% goes towards printing, and the rest goes to shipping, credit card fees, and Kickstarter fees.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This anthology is completed and edited. This anthology is ready to be served up upon funding. Cloudscape Comics has a long standing reputation of successful Kickstarters and fulfilling all commitments. We are reaching out to bookstores as we believe this book would be an excellent addition.

Our biggest hurdle is funding and one we hope you'll help us accomplish. Unfortunately, Cloudscape did not receive any grant funding for this title. Cloudscape is contributing $5500 towards making this project happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Welcome to Mina's now available for purchase online!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers! 

We're really excited to see people have been receiving their copies of Welcome To Mina's in the mail and posting about them on social media.  We always love seeing posts about our backers receiving our books so feel free to share your books on social media. 
You can tag us on Twitter with @CloudscapeComic and on Instagram with @CloudscapeComics so we can retweet or share on our stories.

updates.update_userinfo: Mina's is fulfilled: books are in the mail!
updates.update_content:
Hi folks, 

Yesterday, our Executive Director, Jeff, and I spent the afternoon packing up Welcome to Mina's into mailers and printing shipping labels. There were so many packages but we managed to get them all in my car.

Hi Folks, 

This morning, Jeff and I received the shipment of books to our studio! Look at that beautiful stack of boxes sitting in front of our HQ.

updates.update_userinfo: Mina's is at the printers, digital rewards to be fulfilled tonight!
updates.update_content:
Hello Mina's Backers,

First off, I want to thank you all for your patience.  This project has encountered a few hiccups during the book design process that have caused some unanticipated delays.  When we are in the book design phase, we put all the files in place and then review them.  Inevitably with a 145-page graphic novel, we find minor errors in grammar and spelling, and then small changes in art and design that we decide need to be made and this time it took us a bit longer to find them all. That being said, as of today, we have a file that is ready to share!  If you've backed a tier that includes an ebook and/or digital rewards, your rewards will be sent out this evening so keep an eye on your inbox.

Hi Mina's Backers! 

I wanted to give you all an update on where the book is right now. We've requested bios for all the artists and we've been putting together a bio page so you can all read more about the contributors within the book itself.  Jeff has been working away on the book design and we're waiting for the last few pieces to come together before we send it to the printers.  I've been reviewing the book file proofs as we go to make sure there aren't any booboos and so far so good! Hopefully, this stage will be wrapped up soon but I wanted to check in to make sure you don't think we've forgotten about you!

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys for Entree Tier are sent! (For real this time)
updates.update_content:
Hello Mina's backers! 

I wanted to let you all know that I've just sent off all of the surveys.  If you've ordered anything that receives a physical book or your name in the thank you page, you should be receiving it any minute.  It's very important that you take the time to fill them out because that's how we know where to send your reward. We're still working on the final product but want to make sure we have everything in order so once we get the physical books they can be sent out immediately.

updates.update_userinfo: Welcome to Mina's has been fully funded!!!
updates.update_content:
We made our goal! Thank-you everyone for backing Welcome to Mina's. It looks like we're going to print! There's half a day left so we're looking forward to seeing how much farther we can get, but the most important job is done, thanks to your support. We get to print this book!

Jonathon

campaign.story:
Wailing Blade is high-adrenaline fantasy adventure, set in the dark future of mankind.
 When his father is sentenced to death at the hands of the legendary Headtaker, bandit prince Tychon must find a way to save him, or fall to the Wailing Blade himself.
Plus, for the first time ever, you can get your hands on the... 
WAILING BLADE #1 - CREATOR'S EDITION 
And for the ULTIMATE COLLECTOR Ready to Take the Blade with both hands...
WAILING BLADE: HEADTAKER COLLECTOR'S BOX
Intrigued?
Let us tell you more about this extraordinary book!
SYNOPSES
Thousands of years after mankind’s fall from the stars, the remnants of humanity live under the brutal thumb of tyrannical rulers who wield futuristic technology that to the masses, is indistinguishable from magic.
These petty warlords squabble over the dwindling resources of a dying earth, while they themselves bow down to the Tyrant of Minturn, who crushes all who oppose him with his legendary executioners – warriors who wield the deadliest weapons from mankind’s starfaring days.
The most feared of these executioners is the Head Taker, who wields the mighty and unstoppable Wailing Blade – a sword which screams louder than the victims it beheads.
Each year, he travels the breadth of the Tyrant’s empire, dispensing justice and enforcing his will.
Standing against the Tyrant are scattered clans of bandits, like the Windcleavers.
Desperate scavengers, they defy the Tyrant by raiding his caravans, and keeping forbidden technology for themselves.
Their prince, Tychon, sees an opportunity to pluck a great prize from the Tyrant’s grasp, setting himself on a path that leads to a confrontation with death itself, and the WAILING BLADE!

Who will love Wailing Blade?
Fans of Conan, Elric, Masters of the Universe and other sword & sorcery epics.
People who like Mad Max, The Dying Earth, and other tales of dark futures.
Collectors of superior quality modern independent graphic novels from a world-class team of up-and-comers and industry veterans!
If you like your comics with tons of action, over-the-top weaponry, and mind-blowing visuals, THIS IS YOUR BOOK!
What Exactly Do You Get When You Take the Blade and Back This Campaign?
 Wailing Blade Volume 1: Headtaker is a 144-page collection in standard American comic size, on printed on high-quality paper.
 Wailing Blade Volume 1: Headtaker is available in three amazing options -- A super affordable direct market softcover edition, a ComixTribe-Exclusive "Virgin" Wrap-Around softcover trade, and a premium limited edition foil-enhanced, die-cut hardcover.
This volume collects the entire critically acclaimed mini-series originally released in the direct market in single issue format as WAILING BLADE #1-4. 
 Wailing Blade: Headtaker features a foreword written by Batman & The Outsiders and Titans writer Brian Edward Hill, who calls Wailing Blade "a beautiful, volatile reaction, a combination of medieval storytelling and visionary technology... a visionary ride that pulls you through its world." 
⚔️📜 PLUS: This Volume also includes an all-new LEGENDS OF THE WAILING BLADE collection of tavern-tales and yarns that reveal the origins of the legendary weapon, as told and illustrated by top creators in the world of indie comics! (STAY TUNED AS WE REVEAL CREATOR CONTRIBUTORS THROUGHOUT THIS CAMPAIGN!) 
 NEW COLLECTION EXCLUSIVE: This new volume contains a thrilling, never-before-published FINAL SCENE that was not included in the single issue release that fans of this series will not want to miss as it includes the first appearance of TWO more of the Tyrant's merciless EXECUTIONERS!
All backers will also receive loads of additional bonus content in the Tyrant's Cut Digital Deluxe PDF and the Wailing Blade Original Theme Heavy Metal Anthem MP3 by "Making Metal With" George O'Connor! 
 NEW! Wailing Blade #1 - CREATOR'S EDITION is an all-new, campaign exclusive printing of the smash-hit first issue, featuring a side-by-side look at acclaimed writer Rich Douek's script next to artist Joe Mulvey's immaculate black & white line art! This also includes the original Wailing Blade pitch greenlit by ComixTribe and bonus process sketches, making it a must have for writers, artists and comic book process junkies! Each book will be numbered and signed by Joe and I. (**SPECIAL ADD-ON ITEM! Can be added to ANY Pledge Level!**) 
Or take the blade to a whole new level when you get ALL FOUR NEW BOOKS plus a whole lot more in a limited edition WAILING BLADE: HEADTAKER Collector's Box! 
At highest levels, limited opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed materials, and the chance to be EXECUTED BY THE HEADTAKER YOURSELF! 
The Comics Industry Picked Up the Wailing Blade... and LOVES IT! Here's What Critics & Pros are Saying About This Series...

Check out More Reviews for the Book:

AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, HERE'S HOW COMIC FANS AND RETAILERS HAVE REACTED TO WAILING BLADE:
We create for the fans, and the fans help us create, which is why we're here!

Want to See Even More Before You Take the Blade?
We are SO CONFIDENT in our book and believe that if you TAKE THE BLADE you won't want to let go, which is why we're making the entire, extra-sized issue WAILING BLADE #1 available for you absolutely free! 
If you'd like to read even more of Wailing Blade before you back this campaign, we invite you to download THE ENTIRE Oversized FIRST ISSUE absolutely FREE!
⚔️ CLICK HERE TO GET WAILING BLADE #1 FOR FREE ⚔️  
 Who are the Creators Behind the Screaming Blood-soaked Thrill Ride That is Wailing Blade? 
Wailing Blade is an action-packed, dystopian future fever dream created by Rich Douek (Road of Bones, Sea of Sorrows) and Joe Mulvey (SCAM).
Rich Douek
Rich is an award-winning copywriter, and the creator of the independent comic series, Gutter Magic. He has worked on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Universe comics for IDW, and has published short stories in the New York Times-featured All We Ever Wanted anthology, for A Wave Blue World, as well as anthologies for Comixtribe and Red Stylo press. Additonally, he is a moderator of the Comics Experience Creator's Workshop, where he strives to help newer creators learn how to create their own comics and navigate the industry.
Joe Mulvey
Joe made his comics debut as the writer and illustrator of the electrifying super-powered Vegas heist series Scam, from ComixTribe. He is also the writer, artist and creator of the acclaimed children's book Mummy's Always Right, and was published in the Where We Live Anthology from Image Comics. His next series, Happy Hill, will be published by ComixTribe soon! 
Christopher Sotomayor
Chris has been a mainstay at Marvel and DC Comics since 1996 working on titles like Captain America, Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Nightwing, Detective Comics, SuperGirl and pretty much everything else at one point or another.  In addition to working for every major comic publisher in the business, Chris also teaches a course on digital coloring for comics at http://www.comicsexperience.com.  Stay in school. Don't do drugs.
Taylor Esposito
Taylor is a comic book lettering professional and owner of Ghost Glyph Studios. As a staff letterer at DC, he lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws, Constantine, Bodies, CMYK, and New Suicide Squad. Prior to this, Taylor was credited on numerous titles for Marvel as a production artist. He is currently working on a new batch of creator-owned titles, such as Interceptor: Reactor and Friendo (Vault Comics), Exorsisters and Jook Joint (Image), and Babyteeth (Aftershock). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Acursian, Finality) Dynamite (Battlestar Galactica, Rainbow Brite, Army of Darkness/Bubba Ho-Tep), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Rich writes:
For me, growing up, my favorite books were the ones that transported me to different lands. Wild adventures I could get lost in as I followed the heroes along on their journey. Middle Earth, Hyboria, The Young Kingdoms, The Dying Earth. To me, it's not escapism to want to dwell in worlds like that for a little while. The wonderful thing about fiction, especially genre fiction is that it gives you a taste of the impossible - a window into another world. And that feeling, that exhilarating feeling of cracking open a book and getting lost in it, even for a moment, is something that I've always wanted to create for someone else. And I believe that Wailing Blade is a book that will.
It's often said that you should make the comics that you want to see in the world. In that respect, Wailing Blade is everything we've ever wanted to see in a comic. It's got action, it's got adventure. Compelling characters, and a lush, vibrant world for them to inhabit. We couldn't be happier to share it with you.
What Exactly Is This Kickstarter For?
The team has already invested tens of thousands of dollars and thousands of man-hours into the development of this first WAILING BLADE series.
The WAILING BLADE COLLECTION issue is 100% complete and ready to print.
With your support here on Kickstarter, we can truly create the most incredible foil-enhanced, die-cut hardcover edition possible, while also offering some more affordable softcover and digital editions so all fans of hard-hitting dark sci-fi comics can TAKE THE BLADE! 
CHECK OUT THESE INCREDIBLE REWARDS!
ADD-ONS
 Want to customize your pledge and add a few more goodies?

Project Budget
Your support on Kickstarter will help us cover the large cost of printing and shipping thousands of books around the globe.
WAILING BLADE PROJECT TIMELINE

Merchandise in Production: December

BACK WITH CONFIDENCE, BECAUSE COMIXTRIBE ALWAYS DELIVERS! 
We've built our comics business by always delivering for thousands of backers like you. 
This launch will be no different, as we look forward to serving long-time fans and first-time readers alike!
THIS BLADE IS SHARP, SO HERE'S HOW WE'LL PROTECT IT IN TRANSIT!
As Kickstarter fans and collector's ourselves, we know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged.
After consulting with our backers, we've revamped our shipping practices to ensure your comics and collectibles arrive in great condition.
All books shipped will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection.
And our Wailing Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We would be absolutely thrilled if you're ready to take the next step and join this campaign!
Will YOU Be the Next to Take the Blade?
If you've made it this far, you may be ready to be the very next person to TAKE THE BLADE!
If so, we'd like to ask you to scroll back up this page, choose an awesome reward, and pledge to be a part of this campaign today.
On behalf of the entire Wailing Blade team, thank you so much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012.

Our success would not have been possible without the support of thousands of backers like you over the years, many who have come back launch after launch to support us...

So you better believe we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and known for a hands on attention to detail and quality craftsmanship.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign.

During this time of global uncertainty, we realize that steady communication with our backers throughout the campaign and fulfillment process is key... and should any unforeseen issues cause delays, our backers will be the first to know.

We're committed to delivering a superior reward delivery experience for our backers, so we're investing in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house, to eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

ComixTribe and the WAILING BLADE team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we enjoy so much support from returning backers is testament to that.

So we invite you to back with confidence, as we want to be entertaining you for years to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 99% Shipped! Blades are Landing All Over!
updates.update_content:
Hey, friends! 
Just wanted to jump in and let you know that we're now 99% shipped! We have a few backers who's shipping addresses are incomplete that we're trying to verify, but just about everything is already out the door and arriving to you all!

updates.update_userinfo: Don't you just love it when a plan comes together!
updates.update_content: This never gets old!!!

updates.update_userinfo: Let the WAILING BLADE Book Shipping Commence!
updates.update_content:
Hey, Wailing Bladers! 
We have the news you've been waiting for! 
WAILING BLADE Volume 1 Hardcovers & Softcovers have arrived at our warehouse and are starting to ship!

updates.update_userinfo: Unexciting Update... But Some Cool Art!
updates.update_content:
Hey, Wailing Bladers! 
We hoped to have a big shipping update for you by now, but we're more or less in the same spot we were two weeks ago.  We were hoping books would be unloaded through the ports and cleared right through customs and into the hands of our warehouse for shipping out to you all by now... but our latest check in says they're still waiting to get through the log-jam that is the Chicago ports.

Hey, friends and Wailing Bladers! 
It's been a little quiet over here as we've been getting ducks in a row while waiting for books to arrive from overseas. Last time we told you that first week in April was the updated arrival time, but our printer said there's a chance they could be arriving this week or early next... fingers crossed!
In the meantime, we've shipped out:

Hey, friends! We wanted to jump into your inbox and keep you posted on all things WAILING BLADE Kickstarter, but first we wanted to share some awesome news! 
Two of our favorite ComixTribe creators Rich Douek (writer of Wailing Blade) and Alex Cormack (artist of SINK) have been received the awesome honor of having their IDW horror series ROAD OF BONES advance to the final ballot of the BRAM STOKER AWARDS for Superior Achievement in a Graphic Novel!
Hey, Wailing Blade backers! Check out these pics just in from the factory!

updates.update_userinfo: We're Upgrading Your Books! Take a Look!
updates.update_content:
Hey, Wailing Blade fam, happy 2021!
We just wanted to hop on and share some good news with you all, now that the WAILING BLADE: Headtaker books are in the process of being printed up.
In the process of finalizing the book with our printer, we were able to get a better than expected quote on the total order, as well as raise additional funding from backers upgrading their pledges when filling out their Crowdox Surveys.

updates.update_userinfo: TODAY! WAILING BLADE Digital Rewards Unleashed!
updates.update_content: Hey, friends! Great news... Your WAILING BLADE Digital Rewards will be dropping TODAY!

updates.update_userinfo: Suvey's Are LIVE! Adds-Ons Will Help Unlock This...
updates.update_content:
Hey, WAILING BACKERS...
SURVEYS ARE LIVE! 
 CLICK HERE TO ACCESS YOUR WAILING BLADE SURVEY 
Surveys should have hit your inboxes a few hours ago, but if you missed them, you can always click the link above and access them using your Kickstarter email address.
ADD-ON TO YOUR PLEDGE AND UNLOCK MORE PAGES TO THE WAILING BLADE COLLECTION!

project_data.project_name: Wailing Blade V1: Headtaker - Dark Sci-Fi Fantasy Hardcover

campaign.story:
Welcome Back to the House of Fear! 
The series that introduces young readers to the thrills of scary comics is back! This time, our young heroes face off against spiders. Lots and lots of spiders!
In "The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs," Maeve is dreadfully scared of spiders. But when her younger brother is captured by the evil exterminator and his clutter of arachnids, she must overcome her fear to save him...and the world.
What Do You Get?
Our comics blend everything you love about Goosebumps, Scooby-Doo, and Tales From the Crypt. House of Fear was created as a way to introduce kids to scary stories, but our comics are great for anyone who likes fun, exciting fantasy-adventure comics. 
Here's what you can expect when you back our latest campaign:
A complete, stand-alone, 32-page comic.
A story suitable for all ages.
Off-set printing for highest quality.
Bagged/boarded comics shipped in sturdy packaging.
I'm confident you and your family will enjoy our comics. So confident, in fact, we guarantee your satisfaction.  
If you back the printed version and dislike the comics for any reason, return them for a refund (minus shipping fees).
And these comics are already printed, so back with 100% confidence. Check out the limited edition matte covers. The matte cover with the shiny logo looks fantastic.
The matte covers have spot gloss on the title. They look incredible. And the cover stock is a little thicker, too, which is a nice bonus for collectors and children.
What Critics Are Saying  
In 2019, Dark Horse Comics published a collection of House of Fear stories. 
When the book hit shops, we received good feedback from readers and critics. Here's what they were saying about it online... 
Preview Pages
Enjoy this preview of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs. 
Why Quickstarter?
Not long after our last campaign, the House of Fear team created "The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs." We had the Kickstarter page nearly complete, but the timing didn't quit work out. And then, when Covid hit, comics were moved to the back burner for awhile.
Despite having already printed the rewards, we held off on launching until we made progress on future comics. Our goal for this short campaign is to reintroduce the series to readers, and get a jump start on creating more issues in 2021.
The Rewards   
Receive a PDF version of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs.
Receive a print copy of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs.
Get two copies of House of Fear: The Infestation of Mr. Skinny Legs. Perfect for collectors or those with 2-child households.
Get a signed and numbered copy of the 100-page novella, Santa's Claws. Also receive the rare orange matte variant of Mr. Skinny Legs, plus the limited edition green matte cover, too.
Have your pitch or Kickstarter page reviewed by a professional editor! This reward includes a thorough edit and review, plus a Zoom session to discuss the feedback. Plus all of the print and digital rewards.
Have your 22-page comic script edited by a professional editor! Includes a substantive edit of your script, with detailed written comments, plus a Zoom session to discuss the feedback. Also includes the print and digital rewards.
Is your son or daughter an artist? If so, they can design the monster for an upcoming issue of House of Fear. Includes a family Zoom session to discuss the project, plus email updates for each step in the comic-creation process. Includes the Mr. Skinny Legs print and digital rewards.
Is you son or daughter interested in making comics? With this reward, they can be a part of the entire process. Includes a family Zoom session to discuss ideas, plot, and characters for the comic, plus regular email updates for each step in the process. Also includes all Mr. Skinny Legs print and digital rewards.
Black Friday Deals
I've added two Black Friday reward tiers that feature the House of Fear Dark Horse collected edition. I have limited quantities, so if you're looking for a signed copy of the Dark Horse book, act now.
Received a signed copy of the House of Fear Dark Horse collected edition, plus two copies of the standard Mr. Skinny Legs (and the digital rewards, too).
Received a signed copy of the House of Fear Dark Horse collected edition, plus the limited orange matte cover, and the green matte cover (plus the digital rewards).
Milestone Bonus
When the campaign reaches 100 backers, every backer will also receive a look behind the scenes. Call it a director's cut, a digital-deluxe version, or a making-of supplement, but this book will be more than just a script book. More than just a handful of sketches and inked pages, too.
For this digital book, I've pulled together all the resources I have from when we made the comic, including the various stages of the script, art changes and the discussions about them, character descriptions, sample colors, and so much more. 
Add Ons  
After you select a reward tier, Kickstarter will ask if you'd like to add any other rewards. If you backed a physical reward level, you can add one or more of these House of Fear comics.
Where do the Funds Go?
Because the rewards are already printed and ready to go, the bulk of the funding will be used for shipping, packaging costs, and Kickstarter fees. All remaining money will help us fund the creation of future issues of House of Fear.
What About Shipping?
All comics are individually bagged and boarded. 
Any order that consists of 1 or 2 comics will be shipped in a sturdy, oversize envelope (stay flat mailers from Pratt Plus). These will be shipped via First Class Mail. 
All orders of 3 or more comics will be shipped in a Gemini Mailer for added protection. These packages will be shipped via Priority Mail. 
Meet the Creators
Will You Help Us Make More Comics?
It's simple: We want to make more fun, exciting comics and get them to as many readers as we possibly can. And we can't do that without support from readers like you.
Thank you for checking out our latest project. I hope you find a reward that suits you well, and when you do, that you back the campaign and help us continue making action-packed comics for kids of all ages.
Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've done everything we can to minimize risk for backers: All of the rewards are printed, the comics are already bagged and boarded, and I've secured the necessary shipping supplies. 

We're big fans of the Kickstarter platform, and this is our fourth House of Fear campaign. We know how important it is for backers to get their rewards in a timely manner, so we'll do everything we can to meet your expectations. 

Back with confidence.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We're putting the final touches on the seventh issue of House of Fear, and I'm excited to announce that we're launching our next campaign in early March. 
House of Fear: Rubber & Glue is a 32-page issue featuring two complete stories that feature bullies, curses, and a forest of evil eyes and demented trees.
Click here to be notified when we launch.

updates.update_userinfo: (Almost) All comics have been delivered...and a contest
updates.update_content:
I just checked my shipping reports, and all but three of the reward packages I sent have been delivered...and those three are all overseas. I expect the final shipments to be delivered in the next week or two.
If you're in the United States and haven't received your House of Fear rewards yet, let me know. And if you're international and haven't seen your rewards by the end of the month, give me a shout.
In other news, we're gearing up for another campaign. The next one will feature 2 stories. I hope to launch that by the end of next month, so look for news and preview images soon.

I just spent the morning generating mailing labels for the House of Fear Kickstarter packages. My head is spinning a little, to be honest. Whew. 
All packages labeled today (Monday) will ship tomorrow. 
There are about 10 backers who haven't filled out their survey. If that's you, log into Kickstarter and respond as soon as you can. It's the only way I can see your mailing address.

We're about a week from Kickstarter transferring funds from the House of Fear campaign, but I'll be sending out surveys later today. Please submit your responses as soon as you can so I can get your books shipped out quickly. 
As you can see below, all the rewards are packed up and ready to go. I just need addresses for the labels.

updates.update_userinfo: The end is only the beginning
updates.update_content:
The House of Fear campaign has come to an end, but for me, it's only just beginning. I won't consider this campaign a success until every backer has received their reward. To get there, I've got some work to do.
Here's a quick look at what's next:
While Kickstarter is collecting funds and doing the backend processing, I'll get started packaging the books. That way, when the funds transfer to me, I can print the shipping labels and get them in the mail as quickly as possible.

We've got a few hours left in our House of Fear campaign, and I wanted to say thank you. It's been a rough year for so many of us, and here we are, hosting a Kickstarter campaign. At the start of holiday season no less. 
We appreciate the support, and we're excited to make more fun, exciting comics in 2021. We've learned a lot during the last 10 days, too, and we have some cool plans for future Kickstarter campaigns.

We're down to the final 24 hours. Our House of Fear campaign ends at 10:31 local time Monday morning (I have a thing for the numbers 10 and 31, apparently). 
If you know of friends who might be interested in our comics, please let them know that time is running out.
In other news, I was on the Don't Try: Making It Happen podcast with Andrew Guilde. It was an absolute blast. We had a fun conversation about our process for writing comics, what it's like to deal with self doubt, and the joy of working with kids. I'll be honest, it's a long show, so maybe listen at the gym or on a long walk. But if you're interested in the craft, I think it's worth a listen.

updates.update_userinfo: Two New Reward Tiers from Dark Horse
updates.update_content:
I had set up two Black Friday reward tiers that feature the Dark Horse collected edition. My intent was to set them with limited quantities and for a limited duration. But I realized I set them to expire in six hours, not 24. D'oh!
So I've gone ahead and posted the deals again. But this time, there's no time limit. Unless you realize that the campaign ends in 48 hours, in which case, yeah, time is indeed running out.

It's Thanksgiving here in the States, and I wanted to take a moment to tell you how much we appreciate you backing our latest House of Fear campaign.
We have a blast making these comics, but the real reward comes when others read them. Comics are all about collaboration, first when creators work together to develop the story, and then later between us and our readers. 
The more we share with our fans, and the more we hear/see/feel their support for our comics,  the more energized we are to keep making them.

project_data.project_name: House of Fear: The Quickstarter

campaign.story:
Cover A

Spectress & Sabanion is a supernatural horror story about Aneksi, the ghost of Cleopatra's top assassin.  Aneksi has lived as a ghost for centuries and has learned to rejoin the world of the living.  She is at the cusp of finding purpose in her unlife in the modern world of the living.  She is, however, bound by an ancient curse to a demon named Sabanion.  As Aneksi pushes more into the world of the living, she must drag Sabanion with her.  
Issue #2 continues the story of Spectress and her demon partner, Sabanion, and their bloody escape from Containment Facility-4.  They go up against the Moon Crew, the wardens of CONFAC-4, and the Exorcists, priests that wield the unknown power of The Sacred Forlorn.
 
There's nothing quite like Spectress & Sabanion, but if you enjoy fast pacing, tension, mystery and the macabre (Hellraiser, Immortal Hulk, Justice League Dark, the works of Cullen Bunn) this is the book for you!
A unique story incorporating ghosts, Egyptian mythology, magic, demons, Delta Force operators, exorcists and more.
24 interior pages of intense, full-color art.
Inside paper is glossy 70 lb text.  Cover is 85 lb glossy.
FREE US Shipping for all physical rewards.
Both Issues #1 and #2 are 100% complete.
All copies are printed in the United States.
PLAY




             I'm launching this Kickstarter because the idea keeps me up at night.  I love the characters, I love ancient Egyptian mythology,  and I love gritty stories.  I've always wanted to tell engage other people with the bizarre tales that bounce around in my skull.
I also want to tell stories about people that serve in uniform.  Not a u-rah-rah but from a closer, more personal perspective that doesn't come through in movies or pop culture.

Kickstarter is an amazing platform where I hope to reach a larger audience.  I want more people to enjoy this gritty escape into a world of magic, murk, victory and tragedy.   Covid-19 has halted the convention schedule this year, I want to offer comic book fans that independent creator experience.

             The funds we raise through this campaign will be used to pay for the printing and shipping of the book, as well as cover Kickstarter fees and some art costs. Left over funds will be used for Issue #3... ALREADY IN PROGRESS!!  Here's the breakdown of how it will be allocated:
  You will have the opportunity to add any of these items once you've chosen your pledge level and begun the checkout process.

                 Thanks again so much for your support.  I am thrilled with the idea of bringing my story to comic book fans all over the world.  It wouldn't be possible without the support of people willing to take a chance and think outside the box.  Thanks again!
  Please take a look at the reward tiers and select your pledge level and... enjoy!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Cover A for this book has already been published and I have one successful Kickstarter under my belt already. There were no interruptions with production and I have a good relationship with the printer. Comic Impressions is an outstanding print company and I will continue to use them as long as their reliability remains top notch. I've invested in the ComixLaunch Course which has been a fantastic guide for planning, running, and fulfilling a successful Kickstarter.

There were no delays or issues with my last Kickstarter but the Covid-19 situation is always a potential variable. The US Post Office is in a (hopefully) brief state of turmoil. I try to pack my books tenderly, but will gladly replace any item that has been damaged in transit. 

If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to message me. I want your involvement in my project to be as rewarding as possible. 

Thank you again for your time and support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
